Hamisi is a married man with one child who attends school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past year, he has operated a coconut selling business, selling from home to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of lack of enough customers to buy coconuts. 

He dreams of expanding his business to meet his customer demand. With the KES 20,000, he wants to establish a new business of selling vegetables, and would like to purchase sacks of vegetables and tomatoes. He decided to join Yehu to access funds.

loans.use: to establish a new business of selling vegetables; to purchase sacks of vegetables and tomatoes.

loans.name: Jecel

texts.en:
Jecel is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Jecel has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Jecel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jecel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Evelyn has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Evelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Evelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Yexy Dubali

texts.es:
Yexy es una mujer trabajadora y sobre todo una madre amorosa, tiene 2 hijos cuyas edades comprenden entre  3 y 1 año, el mayor ya va a la escuela y el menor aun esta a su cuidado , Yexy  es muy cariñosa y sobre todo tiene  mucha paciencia con ellos y sobre todo es por ellos que ella trabaja, porque quiere darle un buen futuro y sobre todo brindarle una buena educación, ya que ella solo estudio hasta el quinto año de educación secundaria  debido a que sus padre no contaban con los medios económicos suficientes, pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar cosmetología.  

Yexy se dedica a su negocio de venta de ropa se levanta desde muy temprano para poder organizarse, ella trabaja alrededor de 10 horas diarias, asimismo puede atender hasta 12clientes por día, ya que ella va ofreciendo sus productos de casa en casa, en especial a las mamas que viven por su barrio y es que ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy carismática y sobre todo porque le gusta tratar bien a sus clientes

Yexy esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda ella podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio, en especial ropa para la temporada de verano, con ello tendrá mayores ingresos y podrá seguir ahorrando para poder cumplir  su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena calidad de vida y una educación adecuada a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Yexy is a hardworking woman and above all a loving mother.  She has two children between the ages of 1 and 3.  The oldest already goes to school and the youngest is in her care.  Yexy is very affectionate and patient with them because she works on their behalf, because she wants to give them a good future and a good education.  She only reached the fifth year of secondary school because her parents did not have sufficient economic means, but she very much would have enjoyed studying cosmetology.

Yexy works selling clothing.  She gets up very early to be able to get organized and works around ten hours a day.  She is able to serve up to 12 customers a day because she offers her products door-to-door, especially to mothers who live in her neighborhood.  She believes that her business is going well for her because she is very charismatic and above all because she likes to treat her customers well.

Yexy is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she will be able to buy more merchandise for her business, especially summer clothing.  With this she will have higher income and be able to continue saving to be able to realize her biggest dream, "to give a good quality of life and a suitable education to her children."

loans.use: to buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Carmen Yovana

texts.es:
Carmen es una mujer creativa, vive en la ciudad de Camaná, la cual se caracteriza por su clima cálido, por su hermosas playas y porque es una de las ciudades con mucha  producción de Arroz, Carmen como buena peruana le gusta nuestra comida, en especial el riquísimo “Ceviche”, Carmen disfruta mucho de pasar su tiempo libre por las playas de su ciudad, es que el paisaje y el sonido del mar pueden relajar y hacer que uno se olvide de los problemas.

Carmen actualmente trabaja en su negocio el cual es un Salón de Belleza, en el realiza todo lo concerniente a cortes de cabello, le dedica a su trabajo alrededor de 9 horas diarias y puede atender a 15 clientes de manera diaria, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy creativa cuando realiza un corte de cabello y sobre todo porque siempre mantiene limpio su local.

Carmen agradece mucho a los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda ella podrá comprar nuevos utensilios de trabajo como tijeras, maquinas de corte de cabello, planchas entre otros, con ello dará un mejor servicios con las herramientas adecuadas y tendrá mayores ingresos lo que le permitirá seguir ahorrando para poder cumplir su gran sueño:” Tener un Salón de Belleza mas grande”.
texts.en:
Carmen is a creative woman.  She lives in the city of Camaná, which is known for its warm climate, its beautiful beaches, and for its rice production. Carmen, as a good Peruvian, likes Peruvian food.  She especially likes the delicious “Ceviche”.  Carmen enjoys spending her free time at the city beaches.  The scenery and the sound of the ocean can relax you and make you forget your problems.

Carmen currently works in her business, a beauty salon.  She does everything related to cutting hair.  She spends around nine hours a day working.  She can take care of 15 customers a day.  She believes that it is going very well for her in her business because she is very creative when she cuts hair.  Also, and most importantly, she always keeps her place clean.

Carmen is very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to your help she will be able to buy more work utensils like scissors, clippers, and irons among others.  She will give better service with the adequate tools.  She will have greater income, which will allow her to be able to fulfill her biggest dream:  To have a bigger Beauty Salon.

loans.use: to buy more work utensils like scissors, clippers, and irons among others.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Merly has a shop that sells clothing such as t-shirts and blouses. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy stocks of clothing to sell.

Merly has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Merly hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Suzette

texts.en:
Suzette is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married.

Suzette has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Suzette has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Suzette hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children. 

Remedios is providing motorcycle services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for fifteen years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the service.

Remedios has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the service.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has eight children. 

Emily has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for fifteen years. She requested a loan for PHP 13,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Emily has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Emily hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed and has seven children.
 
Edith has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for twenty years. She requested a loan for PHP 14,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Edith has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Julieta has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Julieta has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Julieta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Norielyn

texts.en:
Norielyn is 34 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in the Philippines. Norielyn has a retail shop where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. 

Norielyn is requesting a loan for 13,000 PHP, which she will use to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Norielyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children.
 
Linda has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Linda has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Bat-Erdene

texts.en:
Bat-Erdene, 29, is a fruit seller in the food market which is located in the suburban district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He sells several kinds of fruits such as apples, bananas, kiwis, and grapes. He occasionally supplies some restaurants around the city. His customers always say that Bat-Erdene always sells safe and delicious fruits and they are always happy to buy from him. 

Bat-Erdene wants to increase his working capital in order to expand his business and raise his earnings. The Lunar Year is approaching, which is a traditional and respectful Mongolian celebration. The demand for groceries such as fruits will increase notably during these days. Therefore, he wants to prepare his groceries in advance of the celebration, which is a big opportunity for merchants. The loan he is taking will be dedicated to purchasing fruits in large amounts in order to increase his sales volume.

loans.use: to purchase fruits in large amounts to increase his sales volume.

loans.name: Batsaikhan

texts.en: Currently, the building phase of Batsaikhan's new house is about 70% complete. Now he needs a loan to purchase some more building materials, such as vacuum-insulated windows, wallpaper, and other interior decoration materials. He also wants to install a furnace for an electric heating system in his new house so the house will have smokeless heating. He thinks that smokeless heating is a good way to reduce air pollution all over. Air pollution is one of the biggest and most critical issues in Mongolia, and everyone wants to eliminate it. Furthermore, Batsaikhan has been talking about it to his friends and neighbors. The loan he is taking out will be dedicated to purchasing the necessary building materials to complete his new house and to purchasing an electric heating furnace for smokeless heating.

loans.use: To purchase the necessary building materials to complete his new house and to purchase an electric furnace for smokeless heating.

loans.name: Bebina

texts.en:
Bebina is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has five children. 

Bebina has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Bebina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Vernice

texts.en:
Vernice is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children. 

Vernice has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Vernice has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is 55 years old, married, and has seven children. She lives in the Philippines. Flordeliza has a retail shop where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. 

Flordeliza is requesting a loan for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Flordeliza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 34 years old, married, and has three children. He lives in the Philippines.  Julius operates a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members. He has been doing this for two years and earns 5,000 PHP a month. 

Julius is requesting a loan for 10,000 PHP, which he will use to repair his vehicle for better service. In 2010, he joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. In the future, Julius hopes his children finish their studies and he gains double income from his business.

loans.use: to repair vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Saydakhon

texts.ru: Сайдахон проживает в районе Рудаки. Ей 38 лет. У нее четверо детей. Ее муж находится в Российской Федерации, а дети учатся в средней школе. Сама она занимается выращиванием овощей. В основном она выращивает капусту. Этим видом деятельности она занимается пять лет. Кредит берет для закупа семян.
texts.en: Saydakhon lives in the Rudaki district.  She is 38 years old and has four children.  Her husband is in the Russian Federation, and children attend a secondary school.  Saydakhon is involved in growing vegetables.  She primarily grows cabbage.  She has been involved in this business for five years.  Saydakhon is requesting this loan to purchase seeds.

loans.use: to purchase seeds

loans.name: Jovey

texts.en: Jovey is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines with her husband and three children. For the last 10 years, she has earned a living by running a retail shop where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She is applying for a loan for PHP 16,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2009 and is committed to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Sofronio

texts.en:
Sofronio is 34 years old and is married to a teacher. He lives in Happy Village, Tambulig Zamboanga del Sur.

Sofronio used his last loan to purchase additional grocery products to sell. His business is successful, and he is taking a new loan to purchase new items to expand his product offering. In the future, he hopes to be able to grow his business.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

location.town: Happy Village, Tambulig Zambo. del Sur

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene is married and has two children. Arlene is 42 years old and resides in Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Arlene owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living.  She's been 11 years in this business. Each month, she earns 8,000PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 20,000PHP to purchase additional products to sell. In 2011, Arlene joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary runs a shop where she sells various food items to people who live in her area. She is applying for a loan for KES 40,000 to buy sacks of beans, rice, sugar and maize flour to sell to her customers. Mary has made good use of past loans from Kiva to improve her living standards and hopes to continue doing that in the future. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy sacks of beans, rice, sugar and maize flour to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milka is a 38-year-old single woman. She has two children, ages 10 and 14 years. She describes herself to be committed. 

She operates a beauty salon where she provides services such as weaving, plaiting, manicures, pedicures, perms, facials, blow-drying, etc. She has been involved in this business for seven years and employs one staff member. Her business is located in a residential area and her primary customers are residents of the nearby estate. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high cost of beauty products. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase weaves, hair oil, chemicals, and facial oil. Milka's business goal is to expand her beauty salon and increase her number of clients within five years.

loans.use: to buy beauty products such as weaves, hair oils, chemicals, and facial oil.

loans.name: Estrellita

texts.en:
Estrellita is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children.
 
Estrellita has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for eight years. She requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and  beverages.

Estrellita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. 

Annabelle has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for eight years. She requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Annabelle has been a member of HSPFI since 2007. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. Editha has a shop that sells animal feed by weight and by the sack. She has had this business for 9 years. 

She requested a loan for 14,000 PHP to buy stock of animal feed to sell.  Editha has been a member of HSPFI since 2010 .  In the future, Editha hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of animal feed to sell

loans.name: Suzette

texts.en: Suzette is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines with her husband and one child. For the last five years, she has made a living by running a shop where she sells canned goods, snacks, beverages and various items that she cooks. She is applying for a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. She joined HSPFI last year as a way to continue improving her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Natalya

texts.ru: Наталье 51 год, работает в местной администрации  в должности специалиста по экономическому развитию. В 1996  году, в поисках дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, Наталья начала свой бизнес в животноводстве со стартовой суммы в 6,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорству и настойчивости, на сегодняшний день,  ее хозяйство, насчитывающее шесть коров,одного теленка, пятнадцать овец и одну кобылу,  приносит около 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Наталья обратилась в компанию «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. Доходы от хозяйства Наталья  планирует вложить дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en: Natalya is 51 years old.  She works as an economic development specialist at the local administration office.  In 1996, in search of an additional source of income for her family, Natalya started her animal husbandry business with an initial sum of 6,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her diligence and persistence, today her business with six cows, one calf, fifteen sheep and one horse yields about 15,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of milk and meat products.  In order to further develop her business, Natalya requested a loan in the sum of 120,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase additional heads of livestock.  Natalya plans to invest her business profits into increasing livestock quantities further.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is applying for another loan to start expanding her existing selling business. She will use this 30,000 KES loan to purchase more stocks of shoes and bundles of clothes for resale. In the future, Josephine aspires to continue improving her business. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Josephine has greatly improved her living standard. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of shoes and bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman. She has a son who is two years old. She is a determined woman. 

Jane operates a retail business where she sells clothes.  She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a fast-growing town and her primary customers are new and repeat. Her business challenge is the high cost of clothes.
 
She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase more clothes for selling. 

Jane's hope and dream is to own another clothes stall to increase her income within five years.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for selling.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en: Angelina is a 61-year-old widow who lives in the Philippines with her four children. For the last 10 years, she has earned a living by running a retail shop where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She is applying for a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy more food items to sell to her customers. She joined HSPFI last year as a way to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned good, snacks and beverages to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Sergei

texts.ru:
Сергей использовал прошлый кредит КИВА для того, чтобы сделать отопление в теплицах, но, к сожалению, купил плохой котел, установил его слишком поздно и неправильно. Вследствие чего урожай получил не такой, как планировал изначально. Однако Сергей не отчаивается. Он понимает, что приобрел опыт и теперь хочет все переделать, уже имея знание и понимание того, как и что нужно сделать. 
В этот раз Сергей обратился в КИВА за кредитной помощью, так как он хочет закончить проведение отопления и планирует закупить уголь. Более того, ему еще необходимо приобрести трубы, насосы, краны для завершения процесса проведения отопления. 
Семья Сергея  - молодая. Жена Сергея тоже работает, недавно смогли приобрести автомобиль, есть планы на покупку дополнительного земельного участка неподалеку.
texts.en: Segei used his previous Kiva loan to install heating in his greenhouses, but, unfortunately, bought a bad boiler, installed it too late and incorrectly.  As a result, his harvest did not come out as originally planned.  However, Sergei does not despair.  He understands that he gained experience and now wants to redo everything, having the knowledge and understanding of what and how needs to be done.  This time, Sergei came to Kiva for financial assistance because he wants to complete installing the heating system and plans to buy coal.  Moreover, he also needs to buy pipes, pumps and faucets to finish the process of installing the heating system.  Sergei's family is young.  His wife also works.  They were recently able to purchase a car and have plans to buy another nearby land plot.

loans.use: to complete installing the heating system and buy coal

loans.name: Pablo Antonio

texts.es: Pablo Antonio es un emprendedor que con muchos esfuerzos logro cumplir sus sueños de tener su propio negocio esta actividad la realiza de forma ambulante en el cual ya tiene definidos sus clientes a los que le ofrece  sus productos. Pablo no es la primera vez que está solicitando financiamiento ya tiene un record en el cual está intacto, y sobre todo que el ha aumentado su mercadería. Actualmente está solicitando financiamiento para nuevamente invertir en el negocio en la compra de calzado, cosméticos, cremas, tratamientos, bolsos, toallas, camisas entre otras cosas.
texts.en: Pablo Antonio is an entrepreneur who, with a lot of effort, has managed to accomplish his dream of having his own business.  He sells products in an itinerant manner, and he has a well-defined set of customers to whom he offers his products.  This is not the first time that Pablo has requested a loan; he has an intact credit history, and he has been able to increase his merchandise.  Now he is requesting a loan to invest again in his business, by purchasing shoes, cosmetics, creams, hair treatments, bags, towels, shirts and other items.

loans.use: to buy shoes, cosmetics, creams, hair treatments, bags, towels, shirts and other items.

loans.name: Silifanos

texts.en:
Silifanos is 40 years old and married to Caroline.  They have four children who are between the ages of 18 and 9 years old.

Silifanos sells groceries and has been doing it for the past four years.  He is applying for his first loan to enable him to buy bananas, oranges, tomatoes and onions to add to his stock for sale. 

He has plans to start a school uniform business in the future.

loans.use: To buy bananas, oranges, tomatoes and onions for sale.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is separated and has 4 children.
 
Tessie has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages.  She has had this business for 10 years.  She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Tessie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future,Tessie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Donabel

texts.en:
Donabel is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married.
 
Donabel has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages.  She has had this business for 10 years.  She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Donabel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Donabel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Edlyn

texts.en:
Edlyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a frozen food retail business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,500 through NWTF to buy more frozen food to sell to customers.  Edlyn has been in this business for 2 years.  Edlyn earns additional income from selling of avon, mse and natasha products.

Edlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more frozen foods to sell to customers.

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is 20 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with 1 child. 

Ellen is providing a motorcycle services with her husband as the driver.  She has had this business for 2 years.  She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the service.

Ellen has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Ellen hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the service.

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.ru:
Надежда с мужем и двумя детьми живет в Каменке. Она выращивает овощи в тепличных условиях для последующей оптовой реализации. Она владеет 4 большими теплицами и еще 2 под рассаду. Выращиванием овощей занимается уже 12 лет. В хозяйство вложила уже около 100 000 гривен. Затраты на семена и пленку составляют до 38 000 гривен ежегодно. 

Надежда планирует вложить кредит КИВА в размере 20 000 гривен в последовательное расширение бизнеса и закупку семян, пленки и удобрений. Она устанавливает новую теплицу, и весь процесс обойдется ей в 15 000 гривен, а оставшиеся 5 000 гривен она хотела бы вложить в покупку семян высокорослых помидор. Надежда очень хотела бы посадить больше в будущем сезоне и так как у нее есть возможность добавить теплицу, это позволит ей дополнительно выращивать еще 1 000 кустов помидор. Надежда мечтает купить в своем городке еще один дом для детей и в будущем построить там еще теплицы.   
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Nadezhda lives with her husband and two children in Kamenka. She grows vegetables in a greenhouse for future wholesale. She owns 4 large greenhouses and another 2 in seedlings. She has been cultivating vegetables for 12 years now. She has invested around 100,000 hryvnia in the farm. The cost of seeds and sheeting cost up to 30,000 hryvnia a year. 

Nadezhda plans to use a Kiva loan of 20,000 hryvnia to consistently grow her business and buy seeds, sheeting and fertilizers. She is setting up a new greenhouse and the whole process will cost 15,000 hryvnia. She wants to invest the remaining 5,000 hryvnia in purchasing seeds for tomato shrubs. Nadezhda would very much like to grow more in the upcoming season and with the ability to build a greenhouse, she will be able to grow an additional 1,000 tomato plants. Nadezhda dreams of buying another house for her children in her town and building another greenhouse in the future.

loans.use: build a new greenhouse and buy seed, sheeting and fertilizer.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is a farmer in Kitale Western Kenya.  He is 39 years old and married with 5 children between the ages of 10 and 2 years old.  He has been farming for 10 years with his farm produce of maize, beans and poultry being sold to the local market.

Isaac has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to improve his poultry farming business.  He reiterates that the improvement of the poultry business will help him take better care of his family.  He aspires to have more than 20,000 birds on his farm and remains optimistic about the prospects of growth owing to the skills he has gathered in farming and more specifically in poultry farming.

He however adds that poultry diseases remain a challenge.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Grace Amor

texts.en:
Grace Amor is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married.
 
Grace Amor has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages.  She has had this business for 5 years.  She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Grace Amor has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future,Grace Amor hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is separated with 1 child. 

Grace is providing motorcycle transport services with her husband as the driver.  She has had this business for 5 years.  She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the service.

Grace has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Grace hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the service.

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en:
Antonina is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with 2 children. 

Antonina has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages.  She has had this business for 10 years.  She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Antonina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Antonina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 59 years old and married with 3 children.

Roselyn works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

Roselyn has borrowed and paid 28 loans from NWTF before this loan.  She has been running the sari-sari store for 37 years and also earns an income from fishing.  Roselyn aspires to save enough money to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Nolberto Benito

texts.es:
NOLBERTO BENITO tiene 58 años de estado civil Soltero vive con un sobrino no tiene hijos. Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos.

La ventanilla 14 DE DICIEMBRE esta conformado por 15 socios de la cooperativa San José, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Vicente de las Lomas, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas como la siembra de maíz.

NOLBERTO BENITO se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de  maíz. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar y en las ferias de los alrededores.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es tener más dinero para seguir trabando y comprar un terreno para construir una casa.

En los tiempos libres le gusta mucho hacer deporte con los amigos del barrio.
texts.en:
Nolberto Benito, 58, is single and is living with a nephew; he has no children.  He lives in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

The “14 de Diciembre” communal bank has 15 members from Cooperativa San José.  It’s located in Recinto San Vicente de las Lomas that belongs to Ventanas Canton.  They carry out farming tasks like growing corn.

Nolberto Benito farms corn.  He buys his products in Ventanas and sells in the market there and also in street markets in neighboring areas.

He requests the loan to buy manure, urea, liquids and fertilizers for his corn crops.  The loan has helped him increase income for his family’s consumption and to invest.  His dream is to have money to continue working and to buy a piece of land to build a house.  In his free time he enjoys playing sports with friends from the neighborhood very much.

loans.use: to buy manure, urea, liquids and fertilizer.

loans.name: Luis David

texts.es:
Luis David tiene 30 años de estado civil Union Libre vive con el compañero y un hijo. Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos.

La ventanilla 14 DE DICIEMBRE esta conformado por 15 socios de la cooperativa San José, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Vicente de las Lomas, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas como la siembra de maíz.

Luis David se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de  maíz. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar y en las ferias de los alrededores.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es tener mas dienro para seguir cultivando y tener mas dinero.

Le gusta jugar pelota con el hijo pequeño
texts.en:
Luis David, 30, is in a common law relationship and is living with his spouse and a son.  He lives in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

The “14 de Diciembre” communal bank has 15 members from Cooperativa San José.  It’s located in Recinto San Vicente de las Lomas that belongs to Ventanas Canton.  They carry out farming tasks like growing corn.

Luis David farms corn.  He buys his products in Ventanas and sells in the market there and also in street markets in neighboring areas.

He requests the loan to buy manure, urea, liquids and fertilizers for his corn crops.  The loan has helped him increase income for his family’s consumption and to invest.  His dream is to have money to continue farming and to have more money.  He likes to play ball with his little boy.

loans.use: to buy manure, urea, liquids and fertilizer.

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.ru:
Надежда с супругом и взрослым сыном живет и работает в Мелитополе. Она торгует спортивной одеждой и головными уборами на местном центральном рынке. Занимается реализацией данной группы товаров вот уже 15 лет. Значительный опыт, приемлемые цены, выбор товара обеспечивают Надежде существенное преимущество перед конкурентами. На данный момент у нее в товаре находится 30 000 гривен. Прибыль составляет около 7 000 гривен.  

Надежда планирует вложить кредитные средства от КИВА в закупку товара к приближающемуся весеннему сезону. Она надеется увеличить ассортимент сезонного товара и повысить прибыль за счет дополнительных продаж. Полученную прибыль хотела бы вложить в возможность оздоровиться всей семьей, спланировав летний отдых. Надежда планирует и в дальнейшем развивать бизнес и улучшать благосостояние своей семьи. 
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Nadezhda, her husband and adult son live and work in Melitopol. She sells sports clothes and hats at the local central market. They have been in this line of work for 15 years. Thanks to her considerable work experience, reasonable prices, and good selection, Nadezhda has a significant advantage over her competitors. Currently, she has 30,000 hryvnia in goods. Her profit is around 7,000 hryvnia. 

Nadezhda plans to invest her Kiva loan to buy goods for the upcoming spring season. She hopes to expand her inventory of seasonal items and increase her profit through additional sales. She would like to invest the revenue in the health of her whole family and a summer vacation. Nadezhda plans to further develop the business and improve the overall welfare of her family.

loans.use: purchase spring clothing and hats

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe is 40 years old, married, and has two children who attend school. She sells fish in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years. Ma. Fe is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Ma. Fe is requesting a loan for 15,000 PHP through NWTF, which she will use to buy more stock to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz de 44 años es una mujer que vive al sur de la ciudad con su cónyuge  y tiene un hijo de un mes de nacido. Allí se dedica al oficio de confecciones de ajuar para bebé , oficio que viene desempeñando, después de haber finalizado su trabajo  como empleada de una empresa y tomar su liquidación para gradualmente invertir en telas confeccionar adornos de bebes, para elaborar manualmente toldos y accesorios de bebe, ropas de cama,  que le encargaban sus amigas, lo que    poco a poco le permitió adquirir utilidades y  comprar su máquina, para darse a la tarea de conseguir , quien a crédito o de contado , adquiriera  lo que ella elaboraba desde su capacidad de diseño. Luz en su afán de crecimiento se ha acercado a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización a la cual solicita un credikiva para aumentar su capital de trabajo, pues requiere comprar en mayor volumen y de contado las materias primas e insumos para hacer toldos, sabanas, cojines y forros de almohadas  pequeñas, que le han encargado. Con su inversión logrará   disminuir sus costos,  porque obtendría un precio en descuento por la compra de contado y en mayor volumen que el acostumbrado. Su sueño es el de tener su propia casa y mejorar sus ingresos familiares  para sacar adelante a su hijo, brindándole una educación de calidad y potenciando sus posibilidades de éxito.
texts.en: Luz, 44, is a woman who lives to the south of the city with her husband, and she has a 1-month old baby.  She has a business making layettes for babies.  She's been doing this work ever since she stopped working as an employee of a company.  She took her severance pay, and gradually invested it in fabric to make decorative items for babies.  She makes crib canopies, crib bedding and baby accessories by hand, which are commissioned by her friends.  This has allowed her to gradually make profits, so that she could buy a sewing machine and give herself the task of acquiring customers who will buy the products that she makes and designs, either on a cash or credit basis.  Luz, in her quest for growth, has approached the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo organization to request a Kiva loan to increase her working capital, as she needs to make cash wholesale purchases of raw materials and supplies to make crib canopies, bed sheets, pillows and small pillow-cases that she has orders for.  With this investment, she will be able to reduce her costs, because she will get a discounted price if she can buy in cash and in a bigger volume than usual. Her dream is to have her own house and improve her family's income so that she can provide for her son, and give him a quality education that will enhance his chance to become successful.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of raw materials and supplies in cash, in order to make crib canopies, crib sheets, and small pillows and pillow-cases.

loans.name: De Los Angeles Benita Florencia

texts.es:
DE LOS ANGELES BENITA FLORENCIA tiene 63 años de estado civil en Union Libre con el compañero y con los hijos . Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos.

La ventanilla se llama CIUDADELA LOS ANGELES, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto los Ángeles, pertenecientes al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

DE LOS ANGELES BENITA FLORENCIA se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de  maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar y en las ferias de los alrededores.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es tener salud para seguir trabajando y comprar terreno para dejar a los hijos.

Le gusta ver la television.
texts.en:
De los Ángeles Benita Florencia, 63, is in a common law relationship; she lives with her spouse and children in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

The “Ciudadela de los Ángeles” communal bank is located in Recinto Los Ángeles belonging to Ventanas Canton.  This communal bank is dedicated to short cycle corn and rice farming.

De los Ángeles Benita Florencia is a corn and rice farmer.  She buys her products in Ventanas and sells them in the market there and in street markets in surrounding areas.

She requested the loan to buy manure, urea, liquids and fertilizer for her corn and rice crops.  The loan has helped her increase income for her family’s consumption and to invest.  Her dream is to be in good health to continue working and to buy a piece of land to leave to her children.  She enjoys watching television.

loans.use: to buy manure, urea, liquids and fertilizer.

loans.name: Luis Alfredo

texts.es:
Luis Alfredo es una persona muy responsable y trabajador , él vive en Camaná, ciudad caracterizada por sus hermosas playas, por su producción de Arroz y por su clima cálido, Luis  disfruta su tiempo libre bailando y es que la música lo distrae de los problemas que pueda tener , como buen peruano le gusta mucho la comida y sobre el riquísimo Pescado Frito, el estudio hasta el cuarto año de educación secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Electrónica.

Luis  conduce una mototaxi, se dedica a este trabajo 10 horas diarias, se levanta muy temprano para ir a trabajar, en un día puede atender hasta 50 clientes y es que se levanta muy temprano para realizar sus labores, el cree que le va bien en su negocio debido a que es cordial con los clientes.

Luis está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias al apoyo brindado el podrá realizar mantenimiento a sus mototaxi, asi como tambien reparar el motor de su vehiculo; con esta mejora ya que tendrá un vehículo más seguro y los clientes sentirán mas confianza en utilizar sus servicios; así poder seguir ahorrando para poder cumplir  su gran sueño: “Tener su casa propia”
texts.en:
Luis Alfredo is a responsible person and a hard worker. He lives in Camaná, a city known for it's beautiful beaches, for it's production of rice and for it's warm climate. Luis enjoys dancing during his free time and says that music can distract you from problems you may have. Like a good Peruvian, he loves food, his favorite dish being fried fish. He studied up until the fourth year of secondary school, but he would have liked to study electronics.

Luis drives a mototaxi. He works 10 hours a day. He wakes up very early to begin working and in one day he can serve as many as 50 customers. Many of his customers also wake up early to begin their work. He believes that his business is doing well because he is always friendly with customers.  

Luis is very thankful for the loans from Kiva because they have brought him support to be able to perform maintenance on his mototaxi. He has been able to repair the motor on his vehicle. With this improvement he has a vehicle that is more safe and his customers can have more trust in using his service. As a result he can continue saving to be able to attain his great dream of owning his own home.

loans.use: to pay for upkeep on his mototaxi

loans.name: Vitaliy

texts.ru:
Виталий с женой и 14-летним сыном живет в Водяном и занимается выращиванием ранних овощей, помидор и редиса. У Виталия 6 больших теплиц и две теплицы для рассады. В хозяйство вложено 70 000 гривен. Сельским хозяйством занимается уже 6 лет. Ежегодно затраты на семена и пленку составляют 35 000 гривен. 

Виталию необходима сумма в 20 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить пленку и материалы для теплиц. Виталий планирует сделать отопление в теплицах, и для этого ему нужны дополнительные средства. В бизнесе Виталия видно хорошее развитие. В прошлом году хороший урожай вырастить ему помешали снегопады. Но Виталий не опускает рук и в этом году начал строительство двух новых теплиц с целью расширения.  
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Vitaliy, his wife and their 14-year-old son live in Vodyanoye, where he grows spring vegetables, tomatoes and radishes. Vitaliy has 6 large greenhouses and two greenhouses for seedlings. 70,000 hryvnia have been invested into the farm. Vitaliy has been farming for 6 years. His annual expenditures on seeds and plastic greenhouse covering amount to 35,000 hryvnia. Now he needs 20,000 hryvnia to purchase new plastic covering and other materials for the greenhouses. Vitaliy is planning to install heating in his greenhouses, and therefore needs the additional funds.

Vitaliy's business is developing well. Last year, heavy snowfalls prevented him from growing a good crop. However, Vitaliy is not giving up and this year has begun constructing two new greenhouses in order to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase new plastic covering and other materials for his greenhouses

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Descripción:	El comité La Esperanza, es de la ciudad de Concepción, cuenta con diez miembros en donde la mayoría se dedican a pequeñas actividades. Todas tienen la esperanza de seguir luchando por salir adelante, buscando el progreso de cada una de ellas y la de su comunidad, es por eso que el grupo lleva ese nombre.
Martina se dedica a la venta de ropas, y comenta que ya tiene una clientela bien definida, pues ella siempre trae muy buenos productos para vender, y sumado a eso los buenos precios que tiene. Cuenta que por medio de este negocio ella tiene los medios necesarios para poder sustentar a su familia y cubrir el gasto del día a día.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de verano, con lo cual podrá surtirse y de esa forma tener mayor variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes y de paso cumplir con los pedidos de estos.
texts.en:
Description: The “La Esperanza” (Hope) committee is from the city of Concepción; it has ten members most of which are small business owners.  All have the hope of continuing to get ahead seeking progress for each one of them and for the community.  This is why the committee carries that name.

Martina sells clothes and comments that she has a well-defined clientele because she always brings very good products to sell added to the good prices she has.  She relates that through this business she has the means necessary to support her family and cover daily household expenses.

She asks for the loan to buy summer clothes to stock up on and have more variety to offer her customers while at the same time filling their orders.

loans.use: to buy summer clothes for subsequent resale.

loans.name: Ofelia Cristina

texts.es: Ofelia Cristina tiene 55 años de edad, ella inicio su propio negocio que es una pulpería en el cual lo realizo con ahorros propios y con mucho esfuerzo ha salido adelante junto con sus hijos. Este negocio, lo emprende por la necesidad de generar ingresos a la familia y tener una herramienta de trabajo y ser  independiente. Ofelia está solicitando financiamiento para comprar productos para  pulpería y ofrecerles a sus clientes
texts.en: Ofelia Cristina, 55, started her own business which is a grocery store; she did it with her own savings and with much effort has gotten ahead together with her children.  She started the business because she needed to generate family income and have a source of work in order to be independent.  Ofelia is asking for financing to buy stock merchandise for the grocery store to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Eddy Alfredo

texts.es: Eddy Alfredo es un emprendedor con objetivos y metas en la vida en el cual cumplió su mayor sueño de tener su propio negocio que es un taller de soldadura. El ya es cliente de Fundación León 2000, él es un clientes que mantiene su record intachable, con el anterior crédito compro material de soldadura, ya tiene sus clientes fijos y eventuales que lo visita por el servicio y la calidad que brinda. Actualmente está solicitando financiamiento para comprar más material de soldadura.
texts.en: Eddy Alfredo is an entrepreneur with objectives and goals in life.  He accomplished his main dream of having his own business, which is a welding workshop.  He has already been a client of Fundación León 2000, and has maintained an impeccable credit record.  With his last loan, he bought welding materials, because he already has steady and occasional customers who visit him for the service and good quality that he provides.  He is requesting a loan at this time to buy more welding materials.

loans.use: to buy welding materials

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de la ciudad de Encarnación surgió por contacto de una de las integrantes con la Fundación,  el grupo se encuentra en el 14º ciclo, opera con la Fundación desde el año 2007.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Yolanda, ella tiene 1 hijo  está acompañada con el Sr. Wilfrido. Comenta que se dedica hace varios años a la panadería, además de eso nos cuenta que sus panificados son muy vendidos por que son de muy buena calidad y a precios bajos.
Ella desea utilizar el crédito para la compra de harina, sal, levadura, azúcar y demás insumos necesarios para la elaboración de los panificados. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
This group from the city of Encarnación arose through contact of one of the members with the Fundación. The group is in its 14th loan cycle and has been operating with the Fundación since the year 2007.

One of the members of the group is Yolanda. She has one son and is accompanied by Wilfrido. She says that for several years she's been working in a bakery. In addition to that she tells us that her baked goods sell very well because they are very high quality at low prices.

She wishes to use the loan to buy flour, salt, yeast, sugar, and other necessary supplies to make baked goods. She is grateful to the foundation and to Kiva for the opportunity that she is receiving.

loans.use: to buy flour, salt, yeast, sugar, and other supplies.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita is 45 years old, married, and has five children. She lives in the Philippines. Jovita has a retail shop where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She also cooks and sells native delicacies, snacks, and vegetables such as  squash. She has had this business for 10 years.

Jovita is requesting a loan for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Jovita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Melodia Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MELODIA” iniciará su tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Martha. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de ropa usada, venta de papa, costurera, elaboración de mantas, venta de chuño, venta de ropa

La señora Martha,  indica que hace año y medio que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de papa y chuño que viene trabajando hace años, aprendiendo el mismo de su madre.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de papa y chuño) que adquirirá de las ferias, por mayor, y posteriormente lo venderá en las ferias. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene diez hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Melodia" is starting its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Andes Regional Office. It is made up of four members and is directed by a board of directors headed by Martha. The businesses that are put forward by members of this communal bank are varies, amongst them are: used clothes sales, potato sales, dressmaking, glove embroidery, chuño sales and clothes sales.

Martha indicates that she has been working with Pro Mujer for a year and a half and joined the institution as she was invited by a promoter. 

Currently she has a business that sells potatoes and chuño, which she has been working in for years having learnt the trade from her mother.

The loan that she is taking out is to raise her capital (to buy potatoes and chuño) that she will buy wholesale from markets and then will sell on at market. Her work allows her to generate resources to support her family, as she is married and has ten children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the savings.

loans.use: to buy Chuño

loans.name: Las Kantutas De Franz Tamayo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS KANTUTAS DE FRANZ TAMAYO” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Panamericana, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Domitila. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tejido de mantas, costura de polleras, venta de jugos y helados, venta de mantas de vicuña.

La señora Domitila,  indica que es la primera vez que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una socia. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de mantas de vicuña y otros que viene trabajando hace años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de mantas de vicuña) que adquiere de la de la feria  y posteriormente lo venderá en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene seis hijos.  

En la fotografía no se encuentra la señora Cristina ya que tuvo que irse por razones familiares.
texts.en:
The Las Kantutas de Franz Tamayo communal bank will begin its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana regional office.  It is made up of seven members and run by a board headed by Domitila.  The members of the communal bank carry out a variety of businesses, among which we have weaving ponchos, making "polleras" [traditional skirts], selling juice and ice cream, and selling vicuna ponchos.

Domitila indicates that this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer and that she joined the institution on the invitation of a member.  Currently she has a business selling vicuna ponchos, and others that she has been working on for years.

The loan she will get now is to increase her capital buying vicuna ponchos that she gets at a market and will sell later in the markets.  This form of work allows her to generate resources to help her family, since she is married and has six children.

Cristina is not in the photo because she had to go away for family reasons.

loans.use: to buy vicuna ponchos.

loans.name: Celia Maria

texts.es:
Celia Maria tiene 35 años de estado civil Union Libre vive el compañero y con los hijos. Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos.

La ventanilla 14 DE DICIEMBRE esta conformado por 15 socios de la cooperativa San José, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Vicente de las Lomas, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas como la siembra de maíz.

Celia Maria se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de  maíz. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar y en las ferias de los alrededores.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es tener más dinero para comprar una cocina nueva por que esta vieja la que tiene.

En los tiempos libres le gusta mucho cocinar para la familia.
texts.en:
Celia Maria is 53 years old, is in a live in relationship, and has three children.  She lives in the Ventanas settlement in the Los Ríos province.  The group called “14 DE DICIEMBRE” is made up of 15 members from the San José cooperative and is located in “Recinto San Vicente de las Lomas,” part of the Ventanas settlement.  They are farmers who raise corn.

Celia Maria also raises corn and buys her products in Ventanas and sells them in the marketplace and the surrounding fairs.
She will use the money from this loan to buy fertilizer, urea, and liquid fertilizer for her crop.  The loan has helped her to increase her income for her family and also to invest in supplies.  She hopes to have more money so that she can buy a new stove because the one she has is old.

She likes to cook for the family in her spare time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 42 years old, married, and has two children one of whom attends school while the other has completed school. Caroline has operated a clothes selling business for seven years. Her clients are the local area residents. 

Her husband is employed and also contributes to the family's basic needs. She lives in a rental house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Caroline is requesting a loan for 80,000 KES, which she will use to purchase more bundles of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand her business. Caroline faces a major challenge of transportation. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Sergei

texts.ru:
Сергей с супругой и 6-летним сыном проживает в селе Водяное. Он владеет тепличным бизнесом, выращивая ранние овощи на продажу. Сергей имеет большой участок земли, а на нем две большие теплица 11х100 метров и еще две небольшие 8х20 метров для рассады. Сергей занимается любимым делом уже 7 лет. В хозяйство у него вложено 100 000 гривен. Ежегодно затраты на семена и пленку составляют 60 000 гривен. 

Сергею необходим кредит в 20 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить пленку на 5 000 гривен, семена на 7 000 гривен, сделать ремонт теплицы на 3 000 гривен, а также приобрести уголь и удобрения на 5 000 гривен. Сергею очень важно переделать одну теплицу, сделать ее выше, а также расширить теплицу для рассады и за счет полученных от КИВА средств он надеется все это закончить. 
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en: Sergei lives with his wife and six-year-old son in the Vodyanoye village.  He owns a greenhouse business and grows early vegetables for sale.  Sergei has a large plot of land. where he has two large, 11x100 meter greenhouses and two small, 8x20 meter ones for seedlings.  Sergei has been involved in the business that he loves for seven years.  He has 100 000 hryvnia invested in the business.  His annual expenses for seeds and plastic purchases amount to 60 000 hryvnia.  Sergei needs a loan in the sum of 20 000 hryvnia in order to purchase plastic with 5 000 hryvnia, seeds with 7 000 hryvnia, make repairs in a greenhouse with 3 000 hryvnia and also to buy coal and fertilizers with 5 000 hryvnia.  It is very important for Sergei to rebuild one greenhouse, make it taller and also to expand a greenhouse for seedlings, and he hopes to complete all this work with the funds obtained from Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase plastic with 5 000 hryvnia, seeds with 7 000 hryvnia, make repairs in a greenhouse with 3 000 hryvnia and also to buy coal and fertilizers with 5 000 hryvnia

loans.name: Nezhno

texts.en:
Nezhno is from the village of Kurdgelauri in the Kakheti Region. She is 65 years old and lives with her husband, 72-year-old Vakhtang. Nezhno purchases cosmetics from a wholesaler and then sells them in the village. The family's total average monthly income, including pensions, is 340 GEL. 

According to the Credo poverty score card, Nezhno belongs to the vulnerable poor group, people who have few, if any, assets. They have very limited chances to earn money. Nezhno applied for a Kiva loan within the parameters of the start-up program. She requested credit for restarting the family farming business, which was stopped 10 years ago. Nezhno will use the requested loan amount to cultivate family-owned land and to purchase maize for sowing. In the summer, the family will sell the harvested maize and get additional income. Nezhno plans to reinvest the profits in farming; in particular, she plans to purchase additional land, to cultivate it and to get more harvest for selling.

loans.use: to pay for land cultivation and to purchase maize for sowing

loans.name: Sergo

texts.en:
Sergo is 34 years old. He is unmarried and lives with his parents and younger sister. Sergo is the only income provider in the family. He has a small greenhouse, where cucumbers and greens are grown. Harvested products are consumed in the family and some surplus is sold on the local market. Total average monthly income of the family is 200 Laris. 

Sergo received the loan in the frame of a start-up program. He plans to construct a bigger greenhouse for vegetable growing, most of which will be sold on the local market. It will significantly increase the income of the family. They will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase  materials for greenhouse construction.

loans.name: Abdumumin

texts.ru: Абдумумин проживает в городе Худжанд. Ему 33 года. Он более 15 лет занимается животноводством. В основном он разводит скот у себя дома. Кредит берет для закупа бычков.
texts.en: Abdumumin lives in the city of Khujand.  He is 33 years old.  He has been involved in animal husbandry for over 15 years.  He primarily breeds livestock at home.  Abdumumin is requesting this loan to purchase bulls.

loans.use: to purchase bulls

loans.name: Malohat

texts.ru: Малохат проживает в городе Худжанд. Ей 39 лет. Она занимается животноводством, разводит крупнорогатый скот у себя дома. Этим видом деятельности Малохат занимается пять лет. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Кредит берет для закупа несколько голов крупнорогатого скота с целью увеличения их количества и расширения своей деятельности.
texts.en: Malohat lives in the city of Khujand.  She is 39 years old.  She is involved in animal husbandry and breeds cattle at home.  Malohat has been involved in this business for five years.  She is married and has two children.  She is requesting this loan to purchase several heads of cattle in order to increase its quantity and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase several heads of cattle

loans.name: Zaifamo

texts.ru: Заифамо проживает в районе Хамадони. Ей 48 лет. Она замужем. У нее семеро детей. Она три года как занимается торговлей фруктов. Кредит берет для покупки апельсинов, мандаринов, бананов и киви.
texts.en: Zaifamo lives in the Hamadoni district.  She is 48 years old, married and has seven children.  She has been involved in selling fruits for three years.  Zaifamo is requesting this loan to purchase oranges, tangerines, bananas and kiwi.

loans.use: to purchase winter fruits

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is 54 years old, married, and has five children. She lives in the Philippines. Lina has a retail shop where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. 

Lina is requesting a loan for 9,000 PHP, which she will use to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Lina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Regalo De Dios Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Regalo de Dios lo conforman cuatro personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras. La coordinadora del grupo es Reyna de 31 años quien se dedica al comercio de comida y refrescos desde hace un año. Ella invertirá el crédito en productos para un kiosko que le dieron en un colegio.
La otras integrantes son Gladys de 46 años quien vende nacatamales y sopa desde hace más de 5 años, Filomena de 55 años tiene una tortillería y María de 34 años se dedica a la realización de nacatamales desde hace 3 años.
texts.en:
The "Regalo de Dios" group is made up of four hard-working and enterprising people. The group coordinator is Reyna, 31, who has had a business selling food and soft drinks for one year. 

She will invest the loan in products for her kiosk, which she runs in a high school.

The other members are: Gladys, 46, who has been selling nacatamales (nicaraguan stuffed corn cakes) and soup for more than five years; Filomena, 55, who has a tortilla-making business; and Maria, 34, who has been making nacatamales for three years.

loans.use: To buy products for her kiosk.

loans.name: Lidia Janeth

texts.es:
Lidia Janeth  tiene 18 años de estado civil Soltera vive con los padres no tiene hijos. Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia los Ríos.

La ventanilla se llama VENCEREMOS UNIDOS se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Anchoveta vía al Recinto La Templanza, perteneciente al cantón Pueblo Viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz y arroz.

Lidia Janeth se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace algunos años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar y en Cantón Pueblo Viejo.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es comprar un carro.

Le gusta hacer deporte, y mirar la televisión.
texts.en:
Lidia Janeth is 18 years old.  She is single and lives with her parents.  She has no children.  She lives in the Ventanas canton, in the Los Ríos province.

The communal bank named "VENCEREMOS UNIDOS" ["Together We Will Overcome"]  is located in the Anchoveta district, on the road to the Templanza district, and is in the Pueblo Viejo canton.  The members of this communal bank work in short-cycle agricultural work, growing corn and rice.

Lidia Janeth has been working in agriculture growing corn and rice for the last several years.  She purchases her supplies in Ventanas, and sells her products in the market there and in the Pueblo Viejo canton.

The loan is requested for the purchase of manure, urea, and liquid fertilizers for growing corn and rice.  The loan will help her to increase her income for use by her family and for investment.  Her dream is to purchase a vehicle.

She likes to play sports and to watch television.

loans.use: to purchase manure, urea, and liquid fertilizers.

loans.name: Fanny

texts.en:
Fanny is a hardworking entrepreneur who buys and sells fish, shrimps, and crabs in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 25 years. Fanny earns additional income from her general store and food vending businesses.

Fanny is requesting a loan for 29,500 PHP through NWTF, which she will use to purchase more fish to sell. Fanny has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 34 years old, married, and has three children.  She lives in the Philippines. Joan has a retail shop where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks, beverages, and electronic loads (prepaid cell phone credits).  She has had this business for five years. 

Joan is requesting a loan for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and electronic loads. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Joan hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and electronic loads (prepaid cell phone credits).

loans.name: Felix Ivan

texts.es:
Felix Ivan tiene 25 años de estado civil Union Libre vive con la compañera y con un hijo. Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos.

La ventanilla 14 DE DICIEMBRE esta conformado por 15 socios de la cooperativa San José, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Vicente de las Lomas, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas como la siembra de maíz.

Felix Ivan se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de  maíz. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar y en las ferias de los alrededores.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es tener más dinero para seguir trabando.

Le gusta jugar pelota.
texts.en:
Felix Ivan is 25 years old and lives in a common-law relationship with his companion and a child. He lives in the Ventanas Canton in the Los Ríos Province.

The communal bank 14 de Diciembre is made up of 15 members of the Cooperativa San Jose, located in Recinto San Vicente Las Lomas in the canton of Ventanas and they devote themselves to agricultural pursuits such as growing corn.

Felix Ivan works in agriculture growing corn. He buys his products in Ventanas and he sells in the market there and in the surrounding markets.

He will use the money from this loan to buy compost, urea, and liquid fertilizer for the growing of corn. The loan will help him increase his income for use by the family and to invest. His dream is to have more money in order to continue working.

He likes to play ball.

loans.use: to buy compost, urea and liquid fertilizers

loans.name: Goyo

texts.es:
Goyo de 36 años de edad convive con Verónica, la madre de sus 4 hijos de 14, 10, 8 y 7 años. Esta familia vive en una casa propia en la comunidad de Zona Patria, provincia de Chanchamayo. Goyo es un hombre de campo. Su principal actividad económica es la agricultura. Desde su niño se dedica a esta cansada labor, ahora cuenta con parcelas de terrenos de cultivos propios, ahí siembra plátanos de la variedad isla. Cada semana cosecha 40 jabas, las que vende de 8 a 10 soles cada una. Goyo está contento con sus resultados. Su modalidad de trabajo le ahorra dinero en el traslado de sus productos, ya que los compradores se dirigen hacia su localidad para llevárselos en camiones. Con su incansable labor educa a sus hijos y les otorga condiciones dignas de vida. No se puede quejar. Uno de sus principales problemas a lo largo de su vida como agricultor han sido las enfermedades, como: el “ojo de pollo”, y las cochinillas que se impregnan en las hojas y granos, evitando su crecimiento y maduración.
Goyo es inteligente, sabe como atacar estas plagas, por eso su producción es bien recompensada. Gracias a su ayuda, el podría accederá su préstamo número 7 de MFP. Se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. A la vez menciona sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal, por compartir los mismos intereses de desarrollo. Con el dinero del crédito podrá comprar bolsas de abonos para sus cultivos de café y plátanos; así como para pagar a los operarios quienes se encargarán de limpiar las hojas de la tierra y suciedad.
texts.en:
Goyo, 36, lives with his wife Veronica, the mother of his four children who are aged 14, 10, 8 and 7 years old. The family live in their own house in the town of Zona Patria in the Chanchamayo province. Goyo is a man of the fields. His principal economic activity is agriculture. Since he was a child he has dedicated his life to this tiring work and he now has his own plots of land to cultivate, where he grows 'Isla' bananas. Each week he harvests 40 crates which he sells for eight to ten soles each. Goyo is happy with his results. His method of working allows him to save money as his customers come to him to carry the bananas away on trucks. With his tireless labour he has educated his children and provided them with decent living conditions. Although he doesn't wish to complain, one of his main problems throughout his life as a farmer has been diseases like 'Cock's eye' and lice, which impregnate the leaves and grain, inhibiting their growth and ripening.

Goyo is intelligent and he knows how to tackle these plagues, which is why he is well paid for his produce. Thanks to this, he has been able to obtain his seventh loan from MFP. He promises to repay his monthly instalments in a timely manner. He also mentions feeling at home among the members of his communal bank, as they share the same interests in development. With the loan money he will be able to buy bags of fertiliser to cultivate his coffee and bananas, and to pay the workers who look after cleaning the leaves from the ground.

loans.use: To buy sacks of organic fertiliser and hire workers.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is 32 years old, single and resides in Narok, Kenya. He is a mixed farmer, which he has been doing for the past eight years. He knew KADET through a registered client with KADET. 

He has been a good client and this is his third loan. He has planned to use it to prepare land for farming and to buy farm inputs like maize seeds and fertilizers.

He hopes to make a profit and use it to reinvest in other business. He is an assiduous man who can do more if funded.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Ma. Belinda

texts.en:
Maria Belinda is 44 years old and married with 2 children.

Maria Belinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store (convenience store) in the Philippines and requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc., in her sari-sari store.

Maria Belinda has borrowed and repaid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 12 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Maria Belinda aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 58 years old and a mixed crop farmer. He is married to Martha, who is a farmer. They are blessed with one child. He has been in the farming business for the past three years, with the monthly income of 10,000 KES which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Francis will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his child. His hopes and dreams are to venture into pig rearing which will help him improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Fredolyn

texts.en:
Fredolyn is 56 years old and married with 6 children.

Fredolyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari sari store (convenience store) in the Philippines and requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell.

Fredolyn has borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari sari store for 10 years and also earns an income from her business of buying and selling coconuts.

Fredolyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is 53 years old, married, and has seven children, one of whom attends school.  She works very hard to provide for them.

Luisa runs a spice retail business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as spring onions, onions, garlic, tomato, ginger, etc.  

Luisa is requested a loan for 19,000 PHP through NWTF, which she will use to purchase more stocks of spices to sell. In the future, Luisa would like to save money to provide a secure financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of spices to sell.

loans.name: Consuelo
