texts.es: La socia Consuelo actualmente se encuentra trabajando como docente en un colegio estatal y tambien continua con su negocio de tienda de abarratos en esta ocacion la socia desea sacar el credito para aumentar mas mercaderia para su negocio como en la compra de azucar,fideos,aceite,leche entre otros.
texts.en: Our member, Consuelo, is a teacher at a public school.  She also operates a grocery business.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy merchandise--sugar, pasta, cooking oil, milk, etc.--that she will resell.

loans.use: to stock her retail business.

loans.name: Bozorali

texts.ru: Бозорали проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 48 лет. Женат. Имеет пятерых детей. Образование у него среднее. Он занимается торговлей на рынке. У него имеется торговая точка, где он продает хозяйственные товары. Кредит берет для покупки сервизов, сковородок и одноразовой посуды.
texts.en: Bozorali lives in the Hamadoni district.  He is 48 years old, married and has five children.  He has a secondary education.  Bozorali is involved in sales at a market.  He has a retail outlet, where he sells household products.  He is requesting this loan to purchase dishware sets, skillets and disposable tableware.

loans.use: to purchase dishware sets, skillets and disposable tableware

loans.name: Ma. Filipina

texts.en:
Ma.Filipina is 50 years old, married and has 4 children. 

Ma.Filipina is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 23,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Ma.Filipina has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed 22 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Ma.Filipina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 37-year-old married woman with 7 children, all of whom are enrolled in school. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. Rose owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Rose has operated a food stall for the past 2 years; her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of establishing a café in the future.

With the 25,000 KES, she wants to purchase more stocks of cooking oil, vegetables, wheat flour, rice and beans for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of cooking oil, vegetables, wheat flour, rice and beans for her business

loans.name: Herminda

texts.en:
Herminda is from Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 52 years old. Herminda is married and has two children. 

To make a living, Herminda is running a video rental place. She rents her videos in the local community. Herminda has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Herminda is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital to purchase materials for video place renovation to have a better service. In 2012, Herminda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to to save as a reserve for future emergencies and expand her business

loans.use: to purchase materials for her video place renovation

loans.name: Janith

texts.en:
Janith is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married and has three children. 

Janith has a poultry farm and a shop that sells mature chickens and eggs.  She has operated this business for five years.  She has requested a loan in the amount of 11,000 PHP in order to buy feed for the chickens.

Janith has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Janith hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy feed for the chickens.

loans.name: Segundo Arturo

texts.es:
Segundo Arturo tiene 36 años de estado civil Casado vive con la esposa  y con sus hijos, Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia los Ríos.

La ventanilla se llama VENCEREMOS UNIDOS se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Anchoveta vía al Recinto La Templanza, perteneciente al cantón Pueblo Viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz y arroz.

Segundo Arturo  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace tres años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar y en Cantón Pueblo Viejo.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es  poder comprarse un terreno para así poder seguir produciendo más.
Le gusta salir de paseo con los hijos.
texts.en:
Segundo Arturo is 36 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and children. He lives in the canton of Ventanas in the Los Ríos province.

The communal bank is called Venceremos Unidos and it is located in the Anchoveta precinct on the road to La Templanza precinct in the canton of Ventanas within the Los Ríos province. This communal bank is focused on agricultural works done in the short cycle planting corn and rice. 

Segundo Arturo has made a living in agriculture planting corn and rice for three years. He buys his products in Ventanas and makes his sales in the market of the same community as well as in the canton of Pueblo Viejo.

He is requesting this loan to purchase manure, urea and liquid fertilizers to plant corn and rice. The loan has helped him to increase his income both for his family's consumption as well as for reinvestment. His dream is to be able to buy a piece of land so that he can continue producing more. He likes to go out with his friends.

loans.use: to buy manure, urea, and liquid fertilizers.

loans.name: Martha Maria

texts.es:
Martha María  tiene 46 años de estado civil Unión Libre vive con el compañero   y con sus hijos. Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia los Ríos.

La ventanilla se llama VENCEREMOS UNIDOS se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Anchoveta vía al Recinto La Templanza, perteneciente al cantón Pueblo Viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz y arroz.

Martha Maria se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace algunos años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar y en Cantón Pueblo Viejo.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es comprar un terreno.
Le gusta limpiar la casa.
texts.en:
Martha María is 46 years old, single, and lives with her partner and children.  She lives in Ventanas canton, in the los Ríos province.

The 'Vencedores Unidos' community bank is located in Anchoveta, on the road to La Templanza, in Pueblo Viejo canton.  The members of this bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice. Martha María is a farmer who has grown corn and rice for several years.  She buys her products in Ventanas and sells them in the market here and also in the Pueblo Viejo Canton. 

The requested loan is to buy fertilizer, urea and liquid fertilizer for sewing the corn and rice.  The loan will help her to increase her income for her family and to be able to invest. Her dream is to buy a plot of land.

She enjoys cleaning her home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, urea and liquid fertilizers

loans.name: Marjorie Noemi

texts.es:
Marjorie Noemi tiene 21 años de estado civil Soltera vive con los padres y  no tiene  hijos. Vive en el  Cantón Guaranda provincia de Bolívar.

La ventanilla se llama CIUDADELA LOS ANGELES, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto los Ángeles, pertenecientes al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Marjorie Noemi se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de  maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Guaranda y las vende en el mismo lugar.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es seguir trabajando en la agricultura y aumentar la producción.

Le gusta escuchar música y leer.
texts.en:
Marjorie Noemi is 21 years old and single.  She lives with her parents and has no children.  She lives in Guaranda Canton in the province of Bolívar.

The communal bank is named Ciudadela Los Ángeles and is located in the Los Ángeles precinct of Ventanas Canton.  This bank works in short-cycle agriculture growing corn and rice.

Marjorie Noemi works in agriculture growing corn and rice.  She buys her products in Guaranda and sells them in the market of the same place and in the markets of the surrounding cantons.

She requested the loan to buy manure, urea, and liquid fertilizer for growing corn and rice.  The loan has helped her increase her income for her family's consumption and to invest.  Her dream is to continue working in farming and increase her production.

She likes to listen to music and read.

loans.use: to buy manure, urea, and liquid fertilizer.

loans.name: Blanca Janneth

texts.es:
Blanca Janneth tiene 24 años de estado civil en Union Libre con el compañero y con los hijos . Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos.

La ventanilla se llama CIUDADELA LOS ANGELES, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto los Ángeles, pertenecientes al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Blanca Janneth se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de  maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar y en las ferias de los alrededores.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es seguir trabajando para tener dienro comprar un carro y una desgranadora para el trabajo.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Blanca Janneth is 24 years old, has a common-law relationship and lives with her companion and with the children. She lives in the Ventanas Canton of the Los Ríos Province. 

The communal bank is called Ciudadela Los Angeles and is located in the Los Ángeles area which belongs to the Ventanas Canton. This area is devoted to the farming of short-cycle corn and rice.

Blanca Janneth works in agriculture growing corn and rice. She buys her products in Ventanas and she sells in the market there and in the markets in the surrounding areas.

She is asking for a loan to buy compost, urea, and liquid fertilizer in order to grow corn and rice. The money from the loan will help her increase her income for family use and to invest. 

Her dream is to continue working in order to have the money to buy a car and a threshing machine for work. She likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy compost, urea, and liquid fertilizer

loans.name: Edgar Leonel

texts.es:
Edgar Leonel tiene 22 años de estado civil Union Libre vive con el compañero y con los hijos. Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos.

La ventanilla 14 DE DICIEMBRE esta conformado por 15 socios de la cooperativa San José, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Vicente de las Lomas, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas como la siembra de maíz.

Edgar Leonel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de  maíz. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar y en las ferias de los alrededores.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es que la produccion sea bueno para tener un poco de dinero para dar la educacion a los hijos.

En los tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Edgar Leonel is 22, lives in a common law marriage with his domestic partner and their children in Ventanas canton, province of Los Ríos.

The communal bank 14 DE DICIEMBRE comprises 15 members from Cooperativa San José, is located in the neighborhood of San Vicente de las Lomas, in Ventanas canton, and its main activity is agriculture, such as corn growing.

Edgar Leonel grows corn for a living. He buys his products in Ventanas and sells them in the market located at that same place and in the street markets nearby.

He wants this loan to buy manure, urea and liquid fertilizers to grow corn. This loan helps him increase his earnings to support his family and to invest in his business. His dream is to make a large production and make some money to invest it in his children's education.

In his time off, he likes to practise sports.

loans.use: To buy manure, urea and liquid fertilizers.

loans.name: Elias Francisco

texts.es:
Elias Francisco tiene 28 años de estado civil Soltero vive el papà, no tiene hijos. Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos.

La ventanilla 14 DE DICIEMBRE esta conformado por 15 socios de la cooperativa San José, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Vicente de las Lomas, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas como la siembra de maíz.

Elias Francisco se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de  maíz. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar y en las ferias de los alrededores.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es tener un terreno mas grande para seguir cebrando.

En los tiempos libres le gusta pasar con la familia.
texts.en:
Elias Francisco is 28 years old and single.  He lives with his father in the Ventanas canton in the Los Ríos province and doesn't have any children.  

The communal bank 14 de Diciembre [December 14] is made up of 15 members of the San José cooperative.  It is located in the San Vincente de las Lomas precinct in the Ventanas canton where the members work in agriculture such as growing corn.  

Elias Francisco works in agriculture and grows corn.  He buys his products in Ventanas and he sells them in the markets there and in the surrounding area.  

He is requesting a loan to buy compost, urea and liquid fertilizers for his corn crop.  The loan will help him to increase his income to meet his family's expenses and to invest.  His dream is to have a larger piece of land to farm.  

He likes to spend time with his family in his free time.

loans.use: purchase compost, urea and liquid fertilizers.

loans.name: Juana Yelba

texts.es: Juana Yelba tiene 56 años de edad, en cual su negocio es la venta de mercadería en general ella lo realiza de forma ambulante visita a sus clientes. El protestamos que está solicitando Juana no es para el negocio, es para realizarle a su vivienda algunas  mejoras, con el crédito que está solicitando es para la compra de zinc, pilares y otros productos de construcción.
texts.en: Juana Yelba  is 56 years old.  She sells general merchandise for a living in an itinerant manner, visiting her customers.  She is not requesting a loan for her business, but to make repairs on her house.  With the loan she will buy zinc, pillars and other construction materials.

loans.use: buy zinc, pillars and other construction materials.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov is 42 years old.  She is married and resides with her husband and their five children in Battambang Province, Cambodia.  

Pov has been a tailor for over three years and is successful in her career.  Her husband is a mechanic who repairs automobiles to generate income for the family. In order to improve her husband’s business, Pov is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase automobile spare parts to sell as well as to repair automobiles for his clients.  This loan will enable her husband to generate more income to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business and rebuild her present house to make it much stronger.  In addition, she hopes to support her children while they study to earn bachelors degrees.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her husband's automobile repair business.

loans.name: Oscar Fernando

texts.es:
OSCAR FERNANDO tiene 29 años de estado civil Soltero tiene  un hijo . Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos.

La ventanilla se llama CIUDADELA LOS ANGELES, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto los Ángeles, pertenecientes al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

OSCAR FERNANDO se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de  maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar y en las ferias de los Cantones de los alrededores.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es tener su casa propia y carro para seguir trabajndo.

Le gusta ver la television.
texts.en:
Oscar Fernando is 29 years old. He is not married but is in a civil union with his partner who he lives with along with their children. He lives in the town of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos. 

The communal bank is called Ciudadela Los Angeles, and is located in the community of Los Ángeles, in the small town of Ventanas. The communal bank works with farmers who grow corn and rice on a short cycle.

Oscar Fernando makes a living growing corn and rice. He buys his products in Ventanas and he sells them in the market in Ventanas and in the fairs of the surrounding towns. 

He requested the loan to buy fertilizer, urea and liquid fertilizers to use to plant corn and rice. The loan helped him to increase profits for family consumption and for investment. His dream is to have his own home and car, to continue working. 

He likes to watch television.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer urea, and liquid fertilizers.

loans.name: Williams Fermin

texts.es:
WILLIAMS FERMIN tiene 44 años de estado civil Soltero vive con un hijo. Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos.

La ventanilla se llama CIUDADELA LOS ANGELES, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto los Ángeles, pertenecientes al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

WILLIAMS FERMIN se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de  maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar y en las ferias de los alrededores.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es seguir trabanjo para dar todo a su hijo que no le falte nada.

En los tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte con el hijo.
texts.en:
Williams Fermín, 44, is single living with a son in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.  

The communal bank is called “Ciudadela Los Ángeles” and is located in Recinto Los Ángeles belonging to Ventanas Canton.  It’s dedicated to short cycle corn and rice farming.

Williams Fermín is a corn and rice farmer.  He buys his products in Ventanas and sells them in the market there and in street markets in surrounding areas.

He asked for the loan to buy manure, urea, liquids and fertilizer for his corn and rice crops.  The loan helped him increase income for his family’s consumption and to invest.  His dream is to continue working so that is son won’t need anything.  In his free time he enjoys playing sports with his son.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Orly Geovanny

texts.es:
ORLY GEOVANNY tiene 29 años de estado civil Union Libre vive con la compañera y con los hijos. Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos.

La ventanilla 14 DE DICIEMBRE esta conformado por 15 socios de la cooperativa San José, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Vicente de las Lomas, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas como la siembra de maíz.

ORLY GEOVANNY se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de  maíz. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar y en las ferias de los alrededores.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es comprar un terreno para seguir sembrando.

Le gusta salir con los amigos a pasear.
texts.en:
Orly Geovanny is 29 years old and is in a common law marriage.  He lives with his partner and their children in the Ventanas canton in the Los Ríos province.  

The communal bank 14 de Diciembre [December 14] is made up of 15 members from the San José Cooperative.  It is located in the San Vincente de las Lomas precinct in the Ventanas canton where the members work in agriculture such as growing corn.  

Orly Geovanny works in agriculture and grows corn for a living.  He buys his products in Ventanas and sells them in the market there and the surrounding area.  

He is requesting a loan to buy compost, urea and liquid fertilizers for his corn crop.  The loan will help increase his income to meet his family's expenses and to invest.  His dream is to buy a piece of land to farm.

He likes to take walks with his friends.

loans.use: buy compost, urea and liquid fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her business inventory.

loans.name: Ericka De Jesus

texts.es:
Ericka vive con su familia en la maravillosa provincia de Limón la cual marca una gran diversidad cultural: con una población predominantemente negra y con importantes rasgos de la cultura indígena costarricense, la afro caribeña, blancos y chinos, cada grupo le aporta a la zona su estilo propio. Esta provincia tiene hermosas lugares con arenas blancas, playas y palmeras y exuberantes parques nacionales que protegen bosques húmedos tropicales y arrecifes de coral, así como centenares de especies de flora y de fauna en vías de extinción. El parque nacional Tortuguero, contiene la muestra más grande de bosque húmedo tropical protegido y aquí usted podrá recorrer sus canales y ríos, observar la flora y la fauna, apreciar el desove de las tortugas marinas y tener la oportunidad de observar a más de 300 especies de aves dentro de las que se encuentra la lapa verde, el pavón y los tucanes. En esta zona se llevan a cabo importantes investigaciones científicas y se ha convertido en un punto especial para el turismo científico y ecológico.

Hace unos meses Ericka desea tener suficiente mercadería, la cual vende transportándose por medio de su bicicleta por toda la comunidad, para asi poder salir adelante con su negocio, dedicarle más tiempo, para asi brindarles a los vecinos de la comunidad  prendas de calidad. Con el ingreso que obtenga de este negocio le dará también una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

Es por esto que Ericka está solicitando un crédito por el monto de 600,000.00 (seiscientos mil colones), para comprar mercadería, específicamente ropa interior, para asi continuar haciendo sus ventas ambulantes y llegar a alcanzar sus metas.

Ericka es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Batán, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Y están felices porque los resultados han sido muy buenos y la Empresa ha ayudado a muchas mujeres a trabajar en sus diferentes negocios.
texts.en:
Ericka lives with her family in the wonderful province of Limón which is known for it cultural diversity with a predominantly black population and with important characteristics of Costa Rican indigenous culture, the Afro-Caribbean, white and Chinese, each group bringing to the area its own style.

This province has beautiful white sandy places, beaches and palm trees and lush national parks that protect tropical rainforest and coral reefs, and hundreds of flora and fauna species in danger of extinction.

The Tortuguero National Park contains the largest specimen of protected rainforest and here you can travel on its canals and rivers, observing the flora and fauna, appreciate the nesting of sea turtles and have the opportunity to observe more than 300 species of birds within which can be found the great green macaw, the great currasow, and the toucans. In this area important scientific investigations take place and have become a special topic of scientific and ecological tourism. 

A few months ago Ericka wanted to have enough merchandise, which she sells on her bicycle throughout the community, so she can get ahead in her business, spending more time, and thus giving her neighbors in her community quality clothing. With the income she obtains from this business she gives her family, also, a better quality of life.

This is why Ericka is asking for a loan in the amount of 600,000 CRC in order to buy merchandise, specifically underwear, so she can continue making her traveling sales and reach her goals.

Ericka is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Batán, one of the 150 partner organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. And they are happy because the results have been very good and the organization has helped many women to work in their different businesses.

loans.use: to buy underwear to sell

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
Marcelino de 43 años convive con Domínica, la madre de sus 3 hijos de 23, 20 y 16 años. El mayor ya tiene familia propia. Marcelino vive con sus 3 hijos y su nuera, en una casa propia en la localidad de Zona Patria, provincia de Chanchamayo. Marcelino es alegre y optimista. Gracias a esas cualidades mantiene constancia en su trabajo. De niño aprendió como producir frutos con la agricultura, ya ahora es su actividad económica principal, con la que mantiene a su familia. Son 6 hectáreas las que posee, en 4 siembra café y plátanos. La última cosecha le arrojó 32 sacos de, los que vendió con éxito.  Con la cosecha quincenal de plátanos obtiene de 40 a 50 arrobas las que vende a 4 soles en su misma comunidad, pero el precio sube cuando traslada sus productos hacia la ciudad. Sacando sus cuentas, Marcelino afirma que el conviene vender en sus propias parcelas ya que gasta mucho dinero en el flete.
El trabajo es cansado por eso sus hijos apoyan en las diversas actividades como: siembra, cultivos, abonamiento y cosechas. Éste sería su préstamo número 7 que obtendría de MFP, por eso menciona ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. “Mujeres al futuro” es el nombre de su banco comunal, del que se siente satisfecho.
Invertirá el dinero en la compra de bolsas de abonos para sus cultivos de café. Además pagará los servicios de los jornaleros, son 25 soles por cada 8 horas al día.
texts.en:
Marcelino, 43, and his wife, Dominica, have 3 children, 23-, 20- and 16-years old, respectively.  The oldest has a family of his own.  Marcelino lives with his wife, children and daughter-in-law in a house that he owns in Zona Patria, a rual town in Chanchamayo province.  Marcelino is a happy, optimistic man, qualities that he applies to his work.  He learned farming as a boy and it's now his main source of income and his means of supporting his family.  He owns 6 hectares [about 15 acres] of land, 4 of which he's set aside for growing coffe and platanos.  His last harvest yielded 32 sacks of [dropped word--probably coffee] which he sold at a good price.  Each platanos crop yields 40 to 50 "arrobas" [a unit of weight equal to somewhere between 11 and 16 pounds, depending on the region] of platanos which he can sell locally for 4 soles per arroba.  He says that he couuld make more for his crop in the city, but he sells at a local market because the extra amount that he can make in the city isn't enough to cover the related transportation expenses.  Farming is hard work and he relies on his children to help him sow, tend, fertilize and harvest his fields.  Marcelino is applying for this, his 7th, MFP loan and says that he is committed to repaying it on time.  He is happy with his community bank, Mujeres al futuro.  
He will use part of this loan to buy organic manure for his next coffee crop and the rest to pay for day laborers who he will pay 25 soles for each 8-hour day.

loans.use: to hire day laborers for his farming business.

loans.name: Anush

texts.en:
Anush, who was born in 1963, lives in Sevan with her husband, two sons and a daughter-in-law. With the exception of her elder son, who works as a driver, the others are jobless due to a scarcity of employment opportunities.

For several years Anush worked as a kindergarten teacher, and since 2009 has been operating her own business, renting a stall where she sells household goods, tableware, vases, toys, etc. Anush’s younger son helps her to bring merchandise for her business from Yerevan, and this enterprise provides for the majority of her family’s needs.

Anush is now requesting her second loan from Nor Horizon for 1,000,000 AMD to buy various vases and dishes to resell and also to diversify the household goods assortment of her shop.

loans.use: to buy various vases and dishes to resell and also to diversify the household goods assortment of her shop.

loans.name: Fany Carmita

texts.es:
Fanny Carmita tiene 35 años de estado civil Casada, vive con sus hijos, en el Cantón Chillanes provincia  de Bolívar.

La ventanilla LUZ Y PROGRESO se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Josè de Guayabal, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz fréjol ,arveja,  a la compra venta de pollos, terneros, chanchos.

Fanny Carmita  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol, arveja, y a la crianza de pollos chanchos y terneros. Las compras y las ventas de los productos lo hace en Chillanes.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz, fréjol, arveja y  para la compra de comida adecuada para sus animales. 

El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es incrementar los sembríos tener dinero para construir la casa para la familia.

En los tiempos libres le gusta pasar con sus hijos  y  disfrutar de las fechas del Carnaval.
texts.en:
Fanny Carmita is 35 years years old, married and lives with her children in the canton of Chillanes in the province of Bolivar.

The ‘Luz y Progreso’ (Light and Progress) solidarity group is located in Recinto San Josè de Guayabal, belonging to the canton of Chillanes. This group works in agriculture, growing short-cycle crops of corn, beans, peas, and in the purchase and selling of chickens, calves, and pigs. The buying and selling takes place in Chillanes.

She is asking for a loan to buy compost, urea, and liquid fertilizer for the planting of corn, beans, and peas and for the purchase of proper food for the animals.

The asked for loan helps increase the income for family use and to invest. Her dream is to have more shade and to be able to build a house some day, to have better earnings and thus a better lifestyle.

She likes to spend time with her children and the arrival of Carnival.

loans.use: to buy compost, urea, and liquid fertilizer for the planting of corn, beans, and peas and for the purchase of proper food for the animals

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en: Annalizais, a 41-year-old married mother of five, lives in the Philippines where she has operated a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages for 10 years. A member of HSPFI since 2011, she is requesting a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. In the future, Annaliza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: This time Ruth is borrowing P30,000 to fund her plastic wares business. The seafood business that she previously funded through NWTF and Kiva continues to provide Ruth and her family with income that is improving their quality of  life.

loans.use: to purchase more plastic stocks to sell.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha, a 54-year-old married mother of four, lives in the Philippines where she has been buying and selling bananas and vegetables using their motorcycle with its side car for 20 years. A member of HSPFI since 2011, she is requesting  a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy more bananas and vegetables to sell. In the future, Editha  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas & vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Marcia Carmita

texts.es:
Marcia Carmita tiene 22 años de estado civil Soltera, vive con papa y su hijo, en el Cantón Chillanes provincia  de Bolívar.

La ventanilla LUZ Y PROGRESO se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Josè de Guayabal, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz fréjol y mora.

Marcia Carmita se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol, mora. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Chillanes.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz, fréjol y mora.  El préstamo le ayudará a aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. El sueño es incrementar los sembríos de maiz  y poder construir algún día una casa para tener mejores ingresos y así un mejor estilo de vida.

le gusta pasear con su hijo.
texts.en:
Marcia Carmita is 22 years old and is single. She lives with her father and her son in the cantón of Chillanes, in the province of Bolívar. 

The communal bank “Luz y Progresso” [Light and Progress] is located in Recinto San José de Guayabal, in the cantón of Chillanes. This communal bank is dedicated to short-cycle agricultural work such as the planting of corn, beans, and blackberries.

Marcia Carmita works in agriculture and plants corn, beans, and blackberries. She does her buying and selling in Chillanes.

The requested loan is for buying fertilizer, urea, and liquid fertilizers for the planting of corn, beans, and blackberries. The loan will help her to increase her income for use by her family and for investment. 

Her dream is to increase her plantings of corn and to some day build her house, to have better income and thereby a better quality of life.

She likes to spend time with her daughter and take her to the carnival.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, urea, and liquid fertilizers for the planting of corn, beans, and blackberries

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Angélica de 51 años es una mujer soltera, así mantiene y educa a sus 2 hijos de 21 años (Elvis) y de 12 (Melva). Con ellos vive en una casa propia en la localidad de Zona Patria en la provincia de Chanchamayo. Angélica tiene un carácter progresista. Con ese ahínco trabaja la tierra. La suerte está de su lado, sus hijos resultaron ser iguales de trabajadores que ella, por eso sus 6 hectáreas de cultivos de café, plátanos y paltas están bien atendidos. Sin embargo, cuando sus frutos están listos para la cosecha requiere necesariamente contratar personal operario.
A la vez, se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de plátanos. Para eso adquiere una arroba a 4 soles en las mismas chacras; y lo vende a 8 soles, generando buenos ingresos.
Laborando de esa manera ha podido comprarse artefactos y algunos artículos para darse comodidades, pero su prioridad es educar a sus hijos, por eso trabajará como lo hace hasta ahora. Con suerte juntará el dinero suficiente para adquirir un carro para desplazarse desde sus terrenos hasta el mercado de la ciudad. Éste sería su préstamo número 7 de MFP, que obtendría gracias a su ayuda. Como en las oportunidades anteriores confirma que será puntual en el pago de las cuotas. “Mujeres al futuro”, es el nombre de su banco comunal, se siente satisfecho con los resultados obtenidos como grupo. Con el dinero podrá comprar arrobas de plátanos en sus variedades, para surtir sus productos y ofrecerlos a los compradores.
texts.en:
Angélica is a 51 year old single woman.  She supports and educates her 2 children who are 21 years old (Elvis) and 12 (Melva).  They live together in their own house in the town of Zona Patria in the province of Chanchamayo.  Angélica is a forward thinker and works hard.  Luck is on her side as her children turned out to be as equally hard-working as she is.  For this reason her 6 hectares of coffee, bananas, and avocados crops are well cared for.  However, when the fruit is ready to be harvested she needs to hire workers.  At the same time she works buying and selling bananas.  She buys sacks for 4 soles in the same fields and turns around and sells them for 8 soles, generating a decent income.  Working this way she has been able to buy appliances and other things to make her life easier, but her priority is to educate her children, so she will continue working as she has done until now.  With luck she will come up with enough money to buy a car to take her from the fields to the market in the city.  

This will be her seventh loan with MFP that she will obtain thanks to their help.  She will make her payments on time as she did with her past loans.  "Mujeres al futuro" is the name of her communal bank and she is satisfied with the group's results.  With the money she will buy sacks of different varieties of bananas to stock and to offer to her buyers.

loans.use: purchase sacks of bananas.

loans.name: Francisca Mayela

texts.es:
Francisca Mayela tiene 43 años y vive con su familia en la maravillosa provincia de Limón la cual marca una gran diversidad cultural: con una población predominantemente negra y con importantes rasgos de la cultura indígena costarricense, la afro caribeña, blancos y chinos, cada grupo le aporta a la zona su estilo propio. Esta provincia tiene hermosas lugares con arenas blancas, playas y palmeras y exuberantes parques nacionales que protegen bosques húmedos tropicales y arrecifes de coral, así como centenares de especies de flora y de fauna en vías de extinción. El parque nacional Tortuguero, contiene la muestra más grande de bosque húmedo tropical protegido y aquí usted podrá recorrer sus canales y ríos, observar la flora y la fauna, apreciar el desove de las tortugas marinas y tener la oportunidad de observar a más de 300 especies de aves dentro de las que se encuentra la lapa verde, el pavón y los tucanes. En esta zona se llevan a cabo importantes investigaciones científicas y se ha convertido en un punto especial para el turismo científico y ecológico.

Desde hace unos meses Francisca Mayela pide que se les brinde algún tipo de ayuda con el pago de la colegiatura de su hija, para asi darle la posibilidad de estudiar y tener buenas bases a futuro.

Es por esto que Francisca Mayela está solicitando un crédito por el monto de 600,000.00 (seiscientos mil colones), para que su hija tenga la oportunidad de superarse y continuar con sus estudios primarios, para que continúe con este ciclo y pueda llegar a ser una gran profesional.
Francisca Mayela es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Batán, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Y están felices porque los resultados han sido muy buenos y la Empresa ha ayudado a muchas mujeres a trabajar en sus diferentes negocios.
texts.en:
Francisca Mayela is 43 years old and lives with her family in the wonderful province of Limón which is known for it cultural diversity with a predominantly black population and with important characteristics of Costa Rican indigenous culture, the Afro-Caribbean, white and Chinese, each group bringing to the area its own style.

This province has beautiful white sandy places, beaches and palm trees and lush national parks that protect tropical rainforest and coral reefs, and hundreds of flora and fauna species in danger of extinction.

The Tortuguero National Park contains the largest specimen of protected rainforest and here you can travel on its canals and rivers, observing the flora and fauna, appreciate the nesting of sea turtles and have the opportunity to observe more than 300 species of birds within which can be found the great green macaw, the great currasow, and the toucans. In this area important scientific investigations take place and have become a special topic of scientific and ecological tourism.

A few months ago Francisca Mayela asked that she be given some sort of support in payment of tuition for her daughter, to give her the possibility of studying and to have a good foundation for the future.

This is why Francisca Mayela is asking for a loan in the amount of 600,000 CRC so that her daughter can have the opportunity to excel and continue with her elementary school education in order to continue with this cycle and to become a successful professional.

Francisca Mayela is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Batán, one of the 150 partner organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. And they are happy because the results have been very good and the organization has helped many women to work in their different businesses.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her daughter

loans.name: Khamis

texts.en:
Khamis, a 34-year-old married father of three, has been successfully operating a retail shop in Mariakani for the past year. Now requesting his first loan from KADET LTD, he plans to purchase more salt, sugar, washing detergents and maize flour.

Khamis will use the anticipated profits to educate his children and repay his loan. He hopes to have a bigger and more profitable business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more salt, sugar, washing detergents and maize flour.

loans.name: Aydee Mary Luz

texts.es:
Aydee es una mujer muy trabajadora, tiene 41 años pero tiene una alegria que muchos jovenes no tienen en estos tiempos, ella vive en la ciudad de chincha, ciudad que se caracteriza por sus danzas tipicas asi como tambien por ser cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano, pero tambien por su gran variedad en cuanto a gastronomia, por ello uno de los platos que a Aydee le encanta mucho es la riquisima "Carapulcra". Aydee solo estudio hasta el quinto grado de secundaria debido a que sus padres no tenian los suficientes medios economicos, pero ella nos dice que ha tenido que aprender y a salir adelante sola y esa enseñanza se la ha dado la vida.

Aydee trabaja en su negocio de venta de frutas, ella es muy responsable y le dedica alrededor de 12 horas diarias, se levanta desde muy temprano a partir de las 4 de la mañana para ir trabajar y es que ella considera que al que madruga Dios lo ayuda, puede atender hasta 20 clientes en el dia y ella cree que le va bien en su negocio debido a que es muy carismatica con los clientes y sobre todo que es muy limpia y ordenada y a las personas le gusta mucho eso.

Ayde esta muy contenta y agradecida con los prestatarios kiva ya que con la ayuda que le han brindado ella podra comprar mas mercaderia, en especial fruta de temporada de verano y con esta mejora podra tener variedad en productos y sus clientes se sientan satisfechos, con ello podra ahorrar para poder cumplir su gran sueño:"tener su carro propio"
texts.en:
Aydee is a hard-working woman.  She is 41 years old, but more lively than younger people are supposed to be, but often aren't these days.  She lives in Chincha, a city famous for its traditional style of dance and for the many sports stars that have grown up here.  The local food is also well known and Aydee tells us that she is particulary fond of "carapulcra".  Aydee had to leave school early--after only five years of secondary school--because her parents couldn't afford her school fees.  She says, though, that she has never stopped learning and that learning has added greatly to her life.

Aydee operates a fruits sales business.  She works about 12 hours a day, rising very early so that she can leave at 4 in the morning to start work.  She sells to as many as 20 customers a day and says that she is happy with her progress.  The business is successful because she is friendly and helpful but, more importantly, because she keeps a clean, well-ordered selling space, something that her customers value.  

Aydee is grateful for the support that she's received from Kiva lenders in the past because she's been able to use the loans to grow her business.  She says that summer seasonal fruits are especially valuable because they add to the range of products she can sell and because her customers want them.  She is saving to fulfill her greatest wish: "to buy a stall of my own".

loans.use: to stock her fruits sales business.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es: Gladis es casada con 03 hijos independientes, a sus 59 años Gladis se siente con todas las fuerzas de seguir trabajando. Actualmente ella se dedica a la venta de comida la cual ofrece desayuno y almuerzo, aparte por las tardes  vende postres como gelatinas, flan, torta helada, entre otras delicias, siendo elaboradas por ella misma,  gracias a dichas actividades a logrado mejorar su vivienda y educar a su nieto ya que esta  a su cargo. El deseo de Gladis es  de terminar de construir su vivienda, pues piensa alquilarlo. Con el crédito que solicito va a comprar sillas y cubiertos para su restaurante y de esta manera darles una mejor atención a sus clientes. Ella agradece a los prestamistas Kiva por  el crédito, ya que hacen posible su progreso.
texts.en:
Gladis is married and has three independent children.  At her 59 years of age, Gladis feels that she is completely strong enough to continue working.  She currently sells food.  She offers breakfast and lunch.  In the afternoons she sells desserts like gelatin, flan, ice cream cake, and other delicacies.  She makes these herself.  

Thanks to these business activities she has managed to improve her house and to educate her grandson, who is under her care.  Gladis’ wish is to finish building her house as she is thinking of renting it.

She will use the requested loan to buy chairs and cutlery for her restaurant.  This way she can give her customers better attention.  She is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the loan; they make progress possible.

loans.use: to buy chairs and cutlery.

loans.name: Severina

texts.en:
Severina, who is married, works hard to support her family. She has had an abaca weaving business in the Philippines for 38 years now, and also earns additional income from a restaurant.

Now requesting a PHP 27000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials for her weaving enterprise, in the future Severina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her abaca weaving business.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is 57 years old and lives in San Vicente Alto,Oroquieta City. She is married and has six children. 

Vicenta has a general store business and earns approximately PHP 1,300 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase more stock for her general store. 

Vicenta has been a member of PMPC for a month.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Arsulita

texts.en:
Arsulita is 71 years old and lives in Oroquieta City.  She is married and has nine children. 

Arsulita runs a general store and earns approximately 2,000 PHP each month doing this type of work.  She has a requested loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase more items to stock her general store. 

Arsulita has been a member of PMPC for four years.

loans.use: to purchase more items to stock her general store.

loans.name: Adelma

texts.es: La socia es la Sra: Adelma continua con su negocio de lavandería y la socia ahora requiere el credito para poder invertir en la compra de detergentes,desmanches y otros productos.La socia desea poder seguir creciendo con su negocio para asi darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Adelma keeps running her laundromat. She is now requesting this loan to invest in detergents, stain removers and other products. She wants her business to grow in order to provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to invest in detergents, stain removers and other products.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucía de 41 años es una mujer separada. Tiene 3 hijos de 16, 14 y 10 años. Con ellos viven en una casa propia en la localidad de Zona Patria en la provincia de Chanchamayo. Lucía es alegre y optimista. Con esa actitud empezó a dedicarse a la agricultura con la ayuda de sus hermanos e hijos. Y algunas veces contrata personal para apresurar las jornadas. En sus 3 parcelas de terrenos tiene sembrado plantas de café y de plátanos. El café lo comercializa cada año, especialmente en los meses de mayo y junio. En cambio los plátanos la sacan de apuros, puesto que su cosecha es cada quince días. “Cada quincena saco de 30 a 20 jabas y lo vendo de 10 a 15 soles cada una”, menciona.
Uno de sus principales problemas fue la falta de personal para las cansadas faenas, con tiempo y presupuesto, ahora puede contratar el equipo deseado. Le gusta su trabajo, por que gracias a él, puede educar y alimentar a sus hijos. Éste sería su préstamo número 7 de MFP, que obtendría gracias a su ayuda. Como en las oportunidades anteriores confirma que será puntual en el pago de las cuotas. “Mujeres al futuro”, es el nombre de su banco comunal, se siente satisfecho con los resultados obtenidos como grupo. Con el dinero, logrará comprar bolsas de abonos para el cafetal y pagar a los jornaleros quienes replantarán el café en suelos más fértiles.
texts.en:
Lucía is 41 years old and separated. She has three children who are 16, 14 and 10 years old, respectively. She lives with them in Zona Patria area, located in Chanchamayo province. 

Lucía is a happy and optimistic woman. With this mindset, she set out to work in the farm supported by her brothers and children. Sometimes, she hires workers to speed up the work. She grows coffee and bananas in three plots of lands. She sells coffee every year, especially during May and June. Bananas, on the other hand, comprise a steady source of income, since they grow every fortnight. She says she grows 20-30 boxes every fortnight and sells them at 10-15 soles each.

One of her main problems is the lack of workers to perform farm work. However, with enough time and budget, she can hire her much-needed team. 

She likes her job. Thanks to her business, she can educate and provide for her children. 

This is her seventh loan from MFP. Once again, she pledges to make her repayments on time. The communal bank is called "Mujeres al futuro". She is pleased with their achievements so far. With this loan, she will be able to buy fertilizer for her coffee plantation and also pay the farm workers who are in charge of replanting the coffee seeds on fertile soil.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and hire farm workers.

loans.name: Angelica Isabel

texts.es:
Angelica Isabel tiene 31 años de estado civil casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos. Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos.

La ventanilla 14 DE DICIEMBRE esta conformado por 15 socios de la cooperativa San José, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Vicente de las Lomas, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas como la siembra de maíz.

Angelica Isabel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de  maíz. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar y en las ferias de los alrededores.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. enfrentan desafios como enfermedades de los cultivos. su sueño es comprar terrenos.

En los tiempos libres le gusta mucho descansar y ver la television.
texts.en:
Angelica Isabel is thirty-one years old and married. She lives with her husband and children in the canton of Ventanas, a province of Los Ríos.

The solidarity group 14 De Diciembre is made up of fifteen members from the Cooperative San José. It is located in the precinct of San Vicente de las Lomas, which belongs to the canton of Ventanas. They make a living doing agricultural work like planting corn.

Angelica Isabel makes a living in agriculture planting corn. She buys her products in Ventanas and sells them in these same markets and in those of the surrounding area.

She requested the loan to buy manure, urea, liquids, and fertilizer to plant corn. This loan helps her increase her earnings for the consumption of her family and to invest. They face challenges like diseases of the crops. Her dream is to buy plots of land.

In her free time she likes to rest and watch television.

loans.use: to buy manure, urea, liquids, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Filemon

texts.es:
Filemón de 68 años, es un padre viudo. Sus hijos de 37, 27 años ya no viven con él, por eso solo vive con Junior de 17 años en una casa propia en la localidad de Zona Patria, en la provincia de Chanchamayo. Hace 30 años que Filemón llegó a Zona Patria, ahí conoció a su esposa, que lamentablemente lo dejó solo al cuidado de 3 hijos. Con esfuerzo y mucho esmero salió adelante y consiguió una estabilidad económica adecuada. 
A su edad, cuenta con energías suficientes para dedicarse a la agricultura. Son 12 hectáreas de terrenos que son de su propiedad, en 3 de ellas produce 40 sacos de café y en otras 2 parcelas, plátanos.
Ahora, uno de sus proyectos es iniciar otra siembra con 10 000 plantitas de café, para el mes de mayo. Ya tiene el tiempo distribuido y organizado. Él y Junior se  dedican a limpiar las chacras y de abonarlas. Pero para este nuevo plan deberá contratar los servicios de jornaleros. Pagará 20 céntimos por cada “pozeo”, es decir por cada agujero que los peones cavarán para plantar el café. “Eso es solo el “pozeo”, ahora para plantar es otro precio”, comenta, advirtiendo que en el campo, la inversión también es fuerte. Éste sería su préstamo número 7 de MFP, por eso agradece su apoyo, anticipadamente. Se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Afirma sentirse satisfecho con el trabajo de su banco comunal, por estar bien organizados. Invertirá el dinero en el pago de los operarios para iniciar una siembra de café con 10 000 plantas.
texts.en:
Filemón is a 68 year old widower.  He has two children, ages 37 and 27, who do not live with him.  He only lives with his 17 year old son, Junior.  He lives in his own house in Zona Patria in the Chanchamayo province.

Filemón arrived in Zona Patria 30 years ago, and that is where he met his wife.  Sadly, she left him alone to care for three children.  With effort and great care he got ahead and obtained adequate financial stability.

He has enough energy, at his age, to devote himself to farming.  He has 12 hectares of land.  On three of them he produces 40 sacks of coffee, and on another two parcels he produces bananas.  Now, one of his projects is to start another planting of 10,000 coffee plants for the month of May.  He already has the time allocated and organized.  

He and Junior will clear the fields and fertilize them.  However, for this new plan he needs to contract the services of day workers.  He will pay 20 céntimos for each “pozeo”.  That means for each whole the workers dig to plant the coffee.  “This is only for the “pozeo”.  Now, in order to plant there is another price,” he comments, informing us that in the field the investment is also hard.

This will be his seventh loan with MFP.  He is grateful for your support in advance.  He pledges to make his payments on time.  He is pleased with the work of his communal bank because they are well-organized.  He will use the money to pay the workers to start the planting of 10,000 coffee plants.

loans.use: to contract workers.

loans.name: Roy

texts.en:
Roy is a 23-year-old Lebanese single man who lives with his parents and two working siblings. His father is the one responsible for covering their costs and expenses. 

As for Roy, he started his own business at an earlier age.  In 2005 he opened his own networking shop, where he also sells cell phones. He is working in installing satellite equipment and repairing computers as well.

Today he is asking for a youth loan of $2,100 from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase added supplies for his business such as cable, cell phones, satellite equipment, and many other items. This Kiva loan will certainly increase his sales, thus his profits. In the future, he plans to focus on one job and better support his family.

loans.use: to purchase added supplies for his business such as cable, cell phones, satellite equipment, and many other items.

loans.name: Zaher

texts.en:
Zaher is a 22-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and three siblings, two of whom are working. His father is working hard to be able to offer a suitable life to his family. 

Despite his young age, Zaher started his own work as a car mechanic in 2008 and has gained a fair number of customers asking for his services. Today, he is requesting a youth loan of $800 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy new mechanical tools for his business, in order to respond rapidly to his clients’ problems. 

He believes that acting properly and honestly is really essential to build such a good and solid career. In the future, he plans to expand his business and hire people to work with him.

loans.use: to buy new mechanical tools for his business.

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
A 43-year-old single mother of three, Peris has operated her clothing sales business in the town of Nakuru for the last 13 years. Introduced to KADET by one of our existing clients, she is requesting her first loan to buy more school uniforms, sweaters and shirts to meet growing demand due to the fact that most schools in the region are beginning new terms.

In the future, Peris hopes to expand her business and open a large shopping mall for selling clothes at wholesale. She also hopes to become one of the best clothes' suppliers in the region as well as improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of school uniforms, sweaters and shirts for sale.

loans.name: Wilmer Ricardo

texts.es:
WILMER RICARDO tiene 28 años de estado civil Union Libre vive con el compañero y con los hijos. Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos.

La ventanilla 14 DE DICIEMBRE esta conformado por 15 socios de la cooperativa San José, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Vicente de las Lomas, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas como la siembra de maíz.

 WILMER RICARDO se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de  maíz. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar y en las ferias de los alrededores.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es tener más dinero para seguir trabando y comprar un terreno para construir una casa.

En los tiempos libres le gusta mucho hacer deporte con los amigos del barrio.
texts.en:
Wilmer Ricardo is 28 years old and lives in a common law marriage with his partner and kids in the canton of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos.

The solidarity group 14 De Diciembre is made up of fifteen members from the Cooperative San José. It is located in the precinct of San Vicente de las Lomas, which belongs to the canton of Ventanas. They make a living doing agricultural work like planting corn.

Wilmer Ricardo makes a living in agriculture planting corn. He buys his products in Ventanas and sells them in these same markets and in those of the surrounding area.

He requested the loan to buy manure, urea, liquids, and fertilizer to plant corn. This loan helps him increase his earnings for the consumption of his family and to make investments. His dream is to have more money to continue working and buy a plot of land on which to build a house.

In his free time he likes to play sports with his neighborhood friends.

loans.use: to buy manure, urea, liquids, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil is a 63-year-old Lebanese widower. He’s living on his own and doing his best to live the rest of his life properly as it should be. He opened his own nuts roastery shop in 2003, after having 40 years of experience in this domain. He’s well known for his delicious roasters.

Today, he wants to borrow $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase roasters and related products in order to carry on his work in a proper way and therefore increase his sales. In the future, he plans to enlarge his roastery and hire someone to work on his behalf.

loans.use: to buy roasters and related products

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 29-year-old Lebanese single man. He lives with his parents and his father is considered the main income provider in the family. For this reason, Mohammad decided to start his own home business in order to help his father with family expenses

Mohammad has been selling cosmetic products since 2004 and has customers from many neighboring areas. He has applied for this youth loan of $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy added beauty products which he hopes will help him attract more customers and therefore increase his sales. In the future, he plans to open his own beauty products shop.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic and beauty products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new materials for his business, such as metal.

loans.name: Wassim

texts.en: Wassim is a 29-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and two siblings. His father seeks to fulfill his family's needs and offer them a respectable life. Because Wassim wants to help his father with their expenses, he decided to start his own home business in 2009. He has been selling clothes to the neighboring shops in his town, and he also has his own loyal customers. Today, he’s asking to borrow a youth loan of $1600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new collections of clothes in order to develop his business and earn a better income. In the future, he plans to open his own clothing shop.

loans.use: to purchase new collections of clothes.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en: Omar is a 21-year-old Lebanese single man. He lives with his five siblings and parents. Omar’s family joined forces and they are more than happy to be supportive and helpful just to help their father cover the heavy costs of life. Omar has five years of experience in the agriculture field and started his own business as a farmer in 2008. He takes good care of his land and he’s sure that it will return excellent and natural fruits and vegetables. Today, he’s in need of a youth loan of $600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a new tractor for his land. He notes that this will develop his business and boost his productivity.  In the future, he plans to buy new land and expand his cultivation.

loans.use: to purchase a new tractor

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 28-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and one child. He’s trying his best to better support his family and be ready to offer help whenever they need it. He has been working as a car mechanic for the past eight years. He works independently from his home, and from time to time he visits his clients at their homes. 

Today, he’s in need of borrowing a youth loan of $1,300 from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l. to renew his mechanical tools. This Kiva loan will facilitate his business operations, and thus his performance. In the future, he plans to open his own garage.

loans.use: to renew his mechanical tools.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a 22-year-old Lebanese single man. He lives with his parents and two siblings, one of whom is working. Michael’s father is the one responsible for paying his family expenses and supporting them. As for Michael, he has owned a clothing shop since 2010, and he’s well known for his fashionable and trendy style. 

Today, he’s asking for a loan of $1600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a new winter collection of clothes in order to increase his sales and therefore enhance his way of living. In the future, he plans to open a new kids' section.

loans.use: to purchase a new winter collection of clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase electrical equipment for his business.

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi is a 22-year-old man. He’s single and lives with his only parent and two siblings, one of whom is working. Fadi is cooperating with his mother in order to satisfy his family needs. 
He has been working as an independent interior designer since 2009 and he’s really happy with what he has attained so far. Now, he intends to take a youth loan of $2000 from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l in order to purchase a new laptop for his business. 
In this way, he will be able to complete his job before presenting it to the customers. In the future, he plans to open his own interior design company.

loans.use: to purchase a new laptop for his business

loans.name: Shadi

texts.en:
Shadi is a 30-year-old married Lebanese man, who lives with his wife and two school aged children. Because of the high cost of living and after being the main income provider in his family, he decided to open his own jewelry workshop in 2003. 
He works to a high standard of professionalism and has his loyal customers. Now, he’s asking for a youth loan of $3000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to renovate his tools and buy additional ones. 
This will facilitate his business operations and boost his productivity. In the future, he plans to make and sell his own jewelry designs.

loans.use: to renovate his tools and buy additional ones

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new electrical tools and supplies for his business, such as electrical cables

loans.name: Alsafa Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Safa Group. It consists of five members who are all females: Fatima, Yarim, Ghania* (not pictured), Nadia and Nabeelah. They are from Sana'a and they know each other very well as they have lived in the same neighborhood for long time. All their projects are home-based. However, they have many clients, mostly women. The group took a loan of 200,000 YER.

Nabeelah, the group leader, is a 35-year-old woman who is married and a mother of eight children. She lives in Sana'a and she acquired her profession of dressmaking  long ago. Her main business is sewing and due to her good reputation, she has three women in her business to help her sewing. When a woman is getting married or having a party, she comes to Nabeela to sew her gown.
 
Through group lending that AMB offers to women who cannot provide guarantees, Nabeela took a loan of 50,000 YER  from AMB in order to purchase textile fabrics, dresses and other basic materials needed for sewing.

In the future, she plans to open a big tailoring shop and she hopes to enroll her younger children in private school.

loans.use: to purchase textile fabrics, dresses and other basic materials needed for her business.

loans.name: Mitzi

texts.en:
Mitzi is 37 years old and lives in Southwestern Poblacion, Calamba. She is married with no children. 

Mitzi has a general store business and earns approximately PHP 4600 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested loan to purchase more stock for her general store.
 
Mitzi has been a member of PMPC for 5 years.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly is 46 years old and lives in Toril,Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has two children.
 
Shirly has a general store business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this work. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase more stocks for her general store.
 
Shirly has been a member of PMPC for three years.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks for her general store.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José, de 51 años convive con Margarita, con ella cuida y protege a Ender de 6 años. Es una familia unida que vive en una casa propia en la localidad de Zona Patria en la provincia de Chanchamayo. José es agricultor. Se dedica a esta actividad desde que era joven. Su inseparable pareja lo apoya en el trabajo, de esa manera han sobrellevado las arduas jornadas. A pesar de eso, las manos no son suficientes para las 3 hectáreas de terrenos de su propiedad. José varia en la producción de sus frutos, esta vez tiene cultivados plantas de café y cítricos como naranjas y limones. Estos frutos se cosechan y venden con facilidad. “Ésta vez sacaré de 1000 a 1100 jabas de naranjas, y cada jaba lo vendo a 3 soles. Si es rentable”, dice. Y como él no es conformista, piensa iniciar otra siembra pero con paltas, para eso deberá ahorrar y adquirir otros terrenos. Ender es su inspiración, así que su trabajo será dedicado y constante. Éste sería su préstamo número 7 de MFP, que obtendría gracias a su ayuda. Como en las oportunidades anteriores confirma que será puntual en el pago de las cuotas. “Mujeres al futuro”, es el nombre de su banco comunal, se siente satisfecho con los resultados obtenidos como grupo. De recibir el dinero, podrá comprar plantas pequeñas de paltas y bolsas de abonos. Así iniciará su siembra de paltas. Esperará 3 años para que produzcan sus primeros frutos.
texts.en: José is fifty-one years old and lives with Margarita. With her he takes care of and protects 6-year-old Ender. They are a united family that live in their own home in the locality of Zone Patria en the province of Chanchamayo. Jose is a farmer and has been making a living as one since he was young. His inseparable partner supports him in his work and in this way they have endured arduous days. Despite this, their hands are not enough for three hectares of land of his property. José varies the production of fruit. This time he is cultivating coffee plants and citruses like oranges and limes. These fruits are gathered and sold with ease. "This time I will take 1000 to 1100 crates of oranges and I will sell each crate for 3 soles. If it's profitable," he says. And as he's no conformist, he plans to begin another sowing season but with avocado. Because of this he must save money and acquire other plots of land. Ender is his inspiration, thus his work will be dedicated and constant. This will be his seventh loan with MFP that he will obtain thanks to your help. As in previous opportunities, he confirms that he will be punctual with his payments. "Mujeres al futuro" is the name of his communal bank he feels satisfied with the results obtained as a group. After receiving the loan, he will be able to buy small avocado plants and bags of manure. In this way he will begin planting the avocados and will wait three years for them to produce their first fruits.

loans.use: to buy avocado plants and bags of manure.

loans.name: Jessa

texts.en:
Jessa is 33 years old and lives in Dolipos Alto, Oroquieta City. She is married with three children. 

Jessa has a general store business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase more stock for her general store. 

Jessa has been a member of PMPC for a year.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Lorlain

texts.en:
Lorlain is 44 years old and lives in San Vicente Alto,Oroquieta City.  She is married with three children. 

Lorlain has a snack vending business and earns approximately PHP 6,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase banana cue ingredients for her snack vending business.  Lorlain has been a member of PMPC for a month.

loans.use: To purchase banana cue ingredients for her snacks vending business

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en: Chantal is 34 years old and has 4 children ranging in age from 3 to 10; the oldest goes to school. Chantal sells pots and flowers and has been doing so for the past 10 years. She has requested a loan to buy more flowers and pots for decoration. She is planning to use the profits to pay school fees and to build a house with the remainder.

loans.use: To buy more flowers and pots for decoration.

loans.name: Eduardo Emilio

texts.es: Eduardo de 66 años vive con su cónyuge y tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 22 a 40 años. Todas las madrugadas él y su cónyuge se levantan e inician el proceso de molienda de maíz, para preparar los deliciosos bollos limpios, de queso y de mazorca, así mismo ordenan y se dedican con una empleada, a la fritangueria de arepas de huevos o dulces, o de queso, carimañolas (productos elaborados a base de yuca), café con leche, refrescos refrigerados, para que sus clientes cuando  temprano pasen por la puerta de su negocio,  sean atraídos por vitrinas llenas de los fresco  productos de consumo, que allí venden  para el desayuno. Eduardo y su esposa iniciaron  su negocio hace 10 años, ofreciendo pequeñas cantidades de fritos y café a la comunidad en general, en un pequeño punto de contacto en su casa.  Uniendo sus esfuerzos y disciplina de trabajo, fue creciendo  su negocio y aumentando el capital, hasta lograr ofrecer  desayunos completos y llegar a vender  bebidas y jugos de frutas naturales de la región en una sala que adecuaron para atender a su clientela. Su sueño es ampliar e independizar el negocio  hasta lograr un gran restaurante, pero necesita crecer en mercado y su capital de trabajo es insuficiente para por si solo hacerlo. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará maíz, café, aceite, leche en polvo, queso, carnes y huevos en mayor proporción, para iniciar su ascenso en la oferta de productos y empezar a negociar con tiendas de los alrededores de su barrio. Inversión que planea será exitosa, por la experiencia del microempresario y porque ha logrado hacer una preventa que aumentaría el volumen de clientes que compren en mayor cuantía.
texts.en: Eduardo, who is 66 years old, lives with his common-law wife and has three children, ages 20 to 40 years old. Early every morning, he and his wife get up and begin the process of grinding corn to prepare their delicious rolls, filled with cheese and with corn. They also supervise and work with one employee in the food stall, where they sell arepas (a filled cornbread) of eggs, sweets, or cheee, carimañolas (a stuffed fritter made from yucca), coffee with milk, and cold soft drinks, so that their customers, however early they pass through the door of their business, are attracted by the cases full of fresh products for consumption that they sell there for breakfast. Eduardo and his wife began their business 10 years ago, offering small quantities of fried food and coffee to the community in general, in a little sales area in their house. Joining their efforts and their work discipline, their business grew and their capital increased until they were able to offer complete breakfasts, and then they reached the point where they could sell beverages and natural fruits juices from their region in a room that was adequate to tend to their customers. Their dream is to expand and make their business independent until they are able to have a big restaurant, but the business needs to grow in market, and their working capital is insufficient to do it alone. This is the reason why they have turned to a Kiva loan, the first financing that they have had at Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which they will buy corn, coffee, oil, powdered milk, cheese, meats, and eggs in larger proportion, so that they can start increasing the products they offer and begin to negotiate with shops around their neighborhood. The investment that Eduardo is planning will be successful, because of his experience as a micro-entrepreneur and because he has managed to have a pre-sale, which will increase the volume of clients who buy in greater quantities.

loans.use: to buy corn, coffee, oil, powdered milk, cheese, meats, and eggs in larger volume

loans.name: Sari Pertiwi Group

texts.en: The Sari Pertiwi group continues to have a loan from MUK to purchase superior piglets. They still need a new loan because the price for piglets is very expensive. The disbursement was not attended by all member because two of them were attending a ceremony at the temple. Six of the members borrowed 1,5M IDR, 11 members borrowed 1M IDR and the total loan was 20M IDR. Ni Luh used her loan to purchase four superior piglets. She hopes this period will be better than the last one and she will earn more profit.

loans.use: To buy four superior piglets

loans.name: Mercedes Obdulia

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Los Bosques  de la ciudad de Portoviejo, ciudad hermosa de verdes  montañas y paisajes  encantadores, conocida desde hace muchos años como la Ciudad Del Valle lugar donde se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Emprendedora de los Bosques.

En este lugar conocimos a la  señora Mercedes. Tiene 55 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad pero dos de ellos  aun viven con ella. Su esposo es Abogado. Ella es  Ing. Comercial.
Ella se dedica al comercio, vende productos industriales como por ejemplo purificadores de agua, tiene un local en donde funciona su negocio y realiza sus ventas  bajo pedido, en este local tiene un centro de llamadas en el cual también vende teléfonos, accesorios de teléfonos, recargas y tarjetas telefónicas entre otras cosas, le va muy bien y lleva tres años dedicado a este negocio.

Este crédito es para comprar teléfonos, tarjetas, recargas telefónicas y accesorios telefónicos para la venta. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que brinda la institución. 
 
Sus metas son seguir trabajando y aumentando su negocio.
texts.en:
The members of the "Emprendedora de los Bosques" communal bank meet every two weeks in the Los Bosques residential complex in the city of Puerto Viejo. Portoviejo is a beautiful city of green mountains and delightful scenery, known for many years as "The City of the Valley." 

This is where we met Mercedes. She is 55, married, and has three children who are already adults, though two of them still live wih her. Her husband is a lawyer, and she is a commercial engineer (university graduate in Business Administration).

She has a business selling industrial products, such as water purifiers for example. She has a shop, from which her business operates, and where she does her sales through orders. 

She has a call center on these premises, where she also sells telephones, as well as telephone accessories, telephone cards, telephone top-ups, and other products. It's going very well, and she has been in this business for three years. 

This loan is to buy telephones, as well as telephone cards, top-ups, and accessories. 

She is a founding member of the communal bank, and she likes it because of the benefits that the institution offers. Her goal is to keep working, and expanding her business.

loans.use: To buy telephones, telephone cards, telephone top-ups, and telephone accessories.

loans.name: Claudia Maria
