texts.en: Sandra is a young mother. She is 25 years old, and lives with her common-law husband and three children who are dependent upon her. She works in housekeeping, providing cooking and cleaning services, and has done this work for more than two years. They bought a care with the money she was able to save from her job and with the help of her husband, who uses this car providing transportation service. Sandra is proud that her work and dedication have helped her family get ahead. Her greatest dream is to have her own business, and in the future she plans to buy computers and rent them out. She is asking for a loan to make some improvements to her home, such as painting and others. Sandra is thankful for the loan.

loans.use: fix up her home

loans.name: Shirley Elena

texts.es:
Shirley tiene 34 años de edad y vive con su familia en una comunidad llamada San Carlos, en la segunda provincia de Costa Rica, Alajuela. En una zona donde se ocupa el primer lugar nacional en la producción de café y azúcar de caña. Produce además granos básicos (arroz, frijoles, maíz), frutas, legumbres, tubérculos y hortalizas. Y en esta provincia está ubicado el Aeropuerto Internacional Juan Santamaría, el más importante del país.

Desde hace unos meses que Shirley se dedica a la artesanía y decoración, ya que cuenta con el apoyo y ayuda de su familia, siente que puede continuar con este negocio,  pero le falta lo principal para que su negocio surja y para que los vecinos de su comunidad se vean beneficiados.  

Es por eso que ella está solicitando un préstamo por el monto de ¢500,000.00 (quinientos mil colones), esto para la compra de materiales para continuar trabajando sus manualidades en cerámica y tela.  

Shirley es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Batán, en una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer crédito y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Shirley is 34 years old and lives with her family in the community of San Carlos, in Costa Rica's second province, Alajuela. This zone is the nation's top producer of coffee and sugar cane. They also produce basic grains (rice, beans, corn), fruits, legumes, tubers, and vegetables. The Juan Santamaría Airport is also here, and it is the most important airport in the country.

Shirley has been working in crafts and decorating for a few months, now that she can count on her family's help and support. She feels she can continue with her business but lacks the capital to grow her business so her neighbors in her community desire her products. For this reason she is asking for a loan of ¢500,000.00 (500,000 colones) to buy materials to keep making her ceramic and fabric crafts.

Shirley is a member of the Batán Community Credit Union, one of 150 member organizations in EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her first loan, and with it, she hopes to continue growing on a personal and economic level. She also hopes to be an active participant of the lending organization in her community.

loans.use: materials for crafts

loans.name: Santa Rosa Group

texts.es:
El comité Santa Rosa  se formó con la unión de 13 vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso.  Ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras que ven en el programa de la fundación una gran ayuda. Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente que les ayudan a fortalecer su compañerismo.
La Señora Agustina es una de las integrantes del comité, ella se dedica  a la venta de plantas de todo tipo y también de abono. Ella ya no tiene hijos chicos y su marido es constructor de obras. Comenta que se sacrifica mucho para poder ayudar a su marido con los gastos de la casa y de esa forma poder hacer las ligero todo. Su meta es poder tener un gran vivero de plantas, donde tendrá mucha variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de plantas y también de  abonos para poder abastecerse con ellos y de esa forma hacer frente a pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The communal bank Santa Rosa was formed by the union of 13 neighbors in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso. They are very hardworking and striving women who see a great help in the foundation's program. The members formed a group that is very united and capable of achieving together, which helps them to strengthen their comradeship.

Señora Agustina is one of the members of the group. She sells plants of all types and also fertilizer. She no longer has young children, and her husband does construction work. She comments that she sacrifices a lot to be able to help her husband with the household expenses and in this way to be able to make everything easier. Her goal is to be able to have a large nursery for plants, where she will have a great variety to offer to her customers. She is applying for a loan for the purchase of plants and also fertilizer so that she can be well stocked and in this way ready for the orders of her customers.

loans.use: to buy plants and fertilizer to sell

loans.name: Tomás

texts.es:
El Sr. Tomas es de la ciudad de Encarnación, es casado, tiene dos hijos y comenta que su familia es su principal pilar y quienes lo inspiran a poder seguir adelante.
El tiene un local comercial alquilado donde se dedica a la venta de cubiertas y al servicio de gomera sobre una avenida principal de la ciudad. Comenta que su taller es el medio principal con el cual el puede tener los medios necesarios para poder dar a su familia todo lo que necesitan para una vida digna y sin privaciones.
El solicita la ayuda de la fundación paraguaya y de Kiva, para la compra de cubiertas, cámaras y demás artículos necesarios para la gomería, ya que siempre está con muchos pedidos y trabajos.
texts.en:
Tomas is from the city of Encarnación, and is married with two children. He says that his family is his mainstay and they inspire him to succeed. He rents a shop on a main avenue in the city where he sells tires and provides tire repair services. He says that his shop is the primary means he has to give his family everything they need for a dignified life without hardship.

Tomas requests the assistance of Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva to purchase tires, tubes and other items necessary to run the tire shop, as he is always busy with many orders and jobs.

loans.use: to purchase tires and tubes for the tire repair shop

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio, tiene la edad  de 54 años, está divorciado, pero vive actualmente con una compañera o pareja. El con el crédito quiere comprar los insumos para la asistencia de sus cerdos como lo son el concentrado  y los medicamentos. El tiene cerdas de cría y necesita asistir sus animales para que no tengan problemas de nutrición y sus lechones nazcan en buenas condiciones y aptos para la venta al mercado local. El tiene como meta generar las mejores ganancias para el bienestar de su familia y tener cada día una mejor estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Antonio, 54, is divorced but currently lives with a companion or partner.  With the loan he wants to buy the supplies for the care of his pigs, which are concentrated feed and medicine.  He has breeding sows and he needs to take care of them so they do not have nutrition problems, and so their piglets are born healthy and fit to sell to the local market.  His goal is to generate the best profits for the well-being of his family and to have better financial stability every day.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He had not had previous loans in state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy feed to take care of his pigs.

loans.name: Americo

texts.es:
El socio Americo; continua con su negocio de compra y venta de palos, el socio compra palos al por mayor y los vende en calidad de leña, el socio los prepara en trozos para la venta asus diferentes clientes, el socio en esta ocasión desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de mas palos que le estan trayendo de Puerto Maldonado la selva peruana; el socio con todo lo que le ingresa puede dar a su familia mejor calidad de vida y apoyar en todo lo que ellos deseen. El socio solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de palos al por mayor y mejorar su calidad de vida.


El socio se muestra muy satisfecho y agradecido por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member, Americo, is continuing his business buying and selling logs, which he buys wholesale and resells as firewood. He cuts the log into pieces to sell to different customers. This time he wants to invest his loan in the purchase of more logs which he brings from Puerto Maldonado in the Peruvian jungle.

With the income from his business, Americo can give his family a better quality of life and provide the things that they want. He has requested the loan to invest in buying wholesale logs and therefore improve his quality of life.

Americo is very satisfied and grateful for the support provided to him, and is committed to complying with the timely payment of his dues.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale logs to sell as firewood, and to improve his quality of life.

loans.name: Abimeleth

texts.es: Abimeleth tiene 30años de edad, el trabaja en una empresa como supervisor de camarón, el tiene una vivienda en cual la está acondicionando que el siempre ha querido hacerle a su casa y realizar las mejoras que se necesitan hacerse, con mucho esfuerzo ha levantado su vivienda. Abimeleth está solicitando financiamiento para la compra de hierro, cemento, bloque, verjas entre otros materiales de construcción.
texts.en:
Abimeleth is 30 years old and works in a company as a shrimp supervisor.  He has a house that he is renovating that he always has wanted to make his own house and do the improvements that need to be done.  With great effort he has built his house.

Abimeleth is requesting a loan to buy iron, cement, cinderblocks, and grilles, among other construction materials.

loans.use: to buy iron, cement, cinderblocks, and grilles, among other construction materials.

loans.name: Esteban Urbino

texts.es:
Esteban es un joven de 27 años el cual vive con su familia en una comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada Mollejones de Platanares, Pérez Zeledón. Mollejones es una comunidad ubicada a 150 kilómetros al sur de la Provincia de San José, la capital de Costa Rica. Se encuentra a 850 metros sobre el nivel del mar. Ahí se cultivan hortalizas, café y además se desarrollan otras actividades como la crianza de ganado de engorde y de cerdos. Existen también algunos proyectos de agricultura orgánica y hortalizas en hidroponía. Además de la agricultura en la comunidad hay talleres mecánicos, un supermercado, pequeños restaurantes (sodas) y una mueblería.

Desde hace algún tiempo Esteban se dedica a la siembra de café. Dice que desde que inició el proyecto los resultados han sido buenos, ya que ha tenido una gran aceptación en su comunidad y los ingresos que ha generado lo han ayudado a sacar adelante a su familia.

En estos momentos lo que desea Esteban es solicitar un préstamo por ¢600,000 (seiscientos mil colones) para comprar de más almacigo, fertilizante y mano de obra que necesita para su finca de café. Con esto espera que su microempresa crezca y llegue a generar más ingresos para mejorar su condición de vida.  

Esteban forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Bancruce una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Como socio ha recibido un microcrédito que le han permitido crecer como microempresarios.
texts.en:
Esteban is 27 and lives with his family in a rural community in Costa Rica called Mollejones de Platanares, Perez Zeldon. Mollegjones is located 150 kilometers south of San Jose, the capital of Costa Rica. It is 850 meters above sea level. The people there grow vegetables and coffee as well as raise livestock including pig and cattle. There are some organic and hydroponic agricultural projects in the city too. Other businesses in the community include mechanics, a supermarket, small restaurants, and a furniture store.

For some time Esteban has grown coffee. He says that from the beginning of the project the results were good because he was accepted into the community and the profits he earned benefited his family,

Currently Esteban applied for a loan of 600,000 colones to purchase the seeds, fertilizer and labor that he needs for his coffee farm. With this support he hopes that his business grows and can generate more income so that he can improve his life.

Estaban is a part of the Bancruce Community Bank one of the 150 partner organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. As a member he has received a microcloan which has allowed him to grow as a small businessman.

loans.use: plant and grow coffee on his farm.

loans.name: Jugina

texts.en: Jugina is married with five children. Jugina is 57 years old and resides at Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Jugina owns and operates a gardening business venture to earn a living and she's been in this business for seven years. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. In 2010, Jugina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Jugina wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children.
 
Flora has a retail shop that buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 24 years. She requested a loan for 9,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Flora has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Flora hopes to improve her business

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” HATUNCHASKAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia tiene 43 años de edad, casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias ejerciendo su carrera profesional de docente del nivel inicial, la socia lleva años trabajando ejerciendo su carrera siendo de esta manera que ella saca adelante a su familia, la socia es una persona bien alegre y responsable con ganas de continuar adelante por su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para realizar los últimos acabados en la construcción de   su casa .
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
This member belongs to the 'HATUNCHASKAS' communal bank, located in the district of Cusco, in Cusco province.

She is 43 years old, and married with three children. She has a career teaching primary level, which she has done for many years. She is a cheerful person and eager to succeed and provide for her family.

The member is requesting this loan to finish building her house. The partner is pleased to have the opportunity for the loan and agrees to comply with the timely payment of her dues.

loans.use: to complete the construction of her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new oven, baking powder and baking flour

loans.name: Lodgenia

texts.en:
Lodgenia is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.
 
Lodgenia has a retail shop that buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 24 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Lodgenia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Lodgenia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 44 years old, married and has four children. She is from Deboloc Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. 

To make a living, Jessica owns and operates a general store in the local community, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste as the main source of income for her business.  Jessica has been engaged in her business for five years and earns approximately PHP 2,000 a month for these activities. 

In 2011, Jessica joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jessica is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocio es socia del Banco Comunal Pureza, tiene 28 años, Rocio tiene un restaurante, tiene un hijo, es madre soltera, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 2 años, en el tiempo que esta en Finca Perú aprendió a ser responsable y a ser mas puntual, da gracias a Finca por el apoyo que le brinda con la educación de sus hijo,  con la capacitaciones  le ayudan en su vida personal como en su negocio, ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en al compra de víveres para el restaurante.
texts.en: 28-year-old Rocio is a member of 'Pureza' (Purity) communal bank, and is a single mother with one son. She has a restaurant and has been a member of Finca Peru for 2 years. During this time she has learned to be responsible and timely, and is grateful for the Finca's support in the education of her son and the training she has received to help her in her personal life and in her business. She will invest this loan in the purchase of food for her restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her restaurant.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS” iniciará su octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Villa Adela, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Julia. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de comida, venta de ropa interior, atención de gimnasio, venta de cigarrillos, tienda de abarrotes, venta de pollos a la brosther, tejido de mantas

La señora Julia,  indica que hace cinco años que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de sus amigas y vecinas. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida (pollos a la brosther) que viene trabajando hace algún tiempo.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de pollos y papas) que adquirirá de la Ceja, por mayor, y posteriormente a la elaboración comercializará en puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación en crédito y la atención en salud.
texts.en:
The group Enterprising Women will start their eighth cycle with the Pro Mujer organization based in Villa Adela. The group is made up of eight members and is managed by its board led by Mrs. Julia. The members of this community association run a variety of businesses including: food sales, clothing sales, managing a gym, cigarette sales, convenience stores, selling roasted chickens and sewing blankets.

Mrs. Julia has worked with Pro Mujer for five years and joined the group when she was invited by her friends and neighbors. Currently she runs a business roasting and selling chickens and has had this business for some time.

This loan will be used to purchase chickens and potatoes, which she gets in La Ceja and then sells from her food stand.This job allows her to generate income for her family; she is married with three children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded the credit trainings and the health care provided.

loans.use: purchase chicken and potatoes for food stand.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is a 31-year-old business lady. She is married to Peter, a businessman. They are blessed with one child who is three years old. She has been selling second hand clothes for the past 10 years with a monthly income of KES 9,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Charity will use the loan to buy a stock of clothes to sell. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her child. Her hope and dream is to open a boutique shop.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
Caridad is a 51-year-old married woman with six children aged between 22 and 37. She and her husband are farmers who work together tilling their land and growing rice crops. They sell their harvest at the market and earn about PHP 3,000 per month.

Caridad has requested this loan to purchase fertilizer and pay for labor. Caridad hopes for her family's living conditions to improve.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay for labor.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a 42-year-old married woman with four children, all of whom are enrolled in school. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of basic family needs. She owns a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Amina has operated a water selling business for the past 3 years. Her potential clients are the area locals. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the KEH 30,000 she wants to install new pipes for her water tank. She decided to join Yehu to easily access loan facilities.

loans.use: To install new pipes for her water tank.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a 28-year-old married man. He has a daughter who is four years old. He describes himself to be patient. He operates a retail store where he sells terrazzo, chippings, cement, strips, oxides etc. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are repeat customers and walk-ins. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase strips, oxides and terrazzo. Richard's business goal is to run a bigger hardware store that is fully stocked within five years.

loans.use: To buy oxides, strips and terrazzo.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Unidas es el grupo formado en la ciudad de Concepción. Ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras, que no temen trabajar, ya que saben que es el único medio para salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias. Ellas vieron en el programa de la fundación paraguaya una gran ayuda, que les permitirá seguir apoyando a sus familias.
Matilde vende ropas de segunda mano, y comenta que le está yendo muy bien en su emprendimiento, ya que la venta de prendas está muy en auge. Su deseo es poder seguir creciendo y de esa forma poder seguir ayudando a su familia y aportando en el hogar.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de segunda mano, con lo cual podrá seguir su negocio. Agradecen a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
'Mujeres Unidas' (United Women) is a group formed in the city of Concepción. They are hardworking and enterprising women, who are not afraid to work because they know that is the only way to succeed and help their families. The Fundación Paraguaya (Paraguayan Foundation) has been a great help, enabling them to continue to support their families.

Matilde sells second-hand clothes and says that her business is doing very well, as garment sales have been booming. Her desire is to continue to grow and therefore continue to help her family and contribute to the household.

She will invest this loan in the purchase of second-hand clothes, which allows her to continue her business. She is grateful to the foundation and to Kiva for the opportunity she has received.

loans.use: to purchase second-hand clothes for subsequent sale

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru: Эльмира выросла в большой семье, у нее 2 брата и 2 сестры, родители были простыми рабочими.  После окончания школы Эльмира помогала семье по хозяйству, о дальнейшем получении образования в то время она могла только мечтать, заработанных денег родителей хватало  только на еду. Основным источником дохода семьи было выращивание свеклы, и с детства Эльмира имеет большой опыт в работе с домашней живностью и полеводством. Выйдя замуж Эльмира с мужем поселились в маленькой времянке на окраине села с земельным участком 10 соток, где выращивали свеклу. Через многие трудности прошла молодая семья, после развала Советского Союза семья пережила трудные годы- работы в селе не было, в то время Эльмира с мужем воспитывали пятерых детей, имели небольшое хозяйство с 2-мя дойными коровами. Кроме своих детей, Эльмира с мужем помогали родительским семьям, где были маленькие братья и сестры. Благодаря упорству и настойчивости Эльмиры, на сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве имеется две дойные коровы и два бычка, продажа молока позволяет заработать примерно 3,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития собственного бизнеса, Эльмира обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. Доходы она планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья, и планирует реализовать свою мечту – построить мини-ферму.
texts.en:
Elmira grew up in a large family with two brothers and two sisters.  He parents were simple workers.   After she finished school, Elmira helped her family around the house.  At the time she could only dream about further education as the money her parents earned was enough only for food.  The family's main source of income was growing beets, and from her childhood Elmira has a great deal of experience in working with domesticated animals and in growing field crops. 

After she married, Elmira and her husband made their home in a tiny shack on the edge of their village and grew beets on 1/10 ha (about 1/4 acre) of land.  Their young family made it through many troubles and, and after the collapse of the Soviet Union, endured difficult years.  There was no work in the village and at that time Elmira and her husband were raising five children and had two dairy cows.   Besides their own children, Elmira and her husband helped their parents' families where they had younger brothers and sisters.  

Thanks to Elmira's perseverance and persistence, today she has two dairy cows and two young bulls.  The sale of milk allows her to earn about 3,000 som (KGS) per month.  With the goal of further developing her business, Elmira turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy additional cattle.  She plans to invest the income in further increasing her herd and to make her dream of building a small farm come true.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Alcira

texts.es:
La señora Alcira Raquel es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora de 36 años quien se dedica al comercio de pollo. Este negocio lo inicio hace 5 años con ayuda de madre y poco a poco ha ido creciendo.
Ella tiene dos hijo de 14 y 11 años de edad por los cuales trabaja arduamente.
texts.en:
Sra. Alcira Raquel, age 36, is a hardworking and enterprising woman. She engages in the sale of chicken. Alcira started this business five years ago with the help of her mother and it has grown little by little.

She has two children, ages 14 and 11, which is why she works hard.

loans.use: to buy chicken.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
La señora Gabriela es casada y tiene dos hijos; esta solicitando un préstamo para invertir en su negocio de venta de productos de belleza por catálogos, ya que no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión en la compra de mercancía y que tiene varios pedidos para entregar. 
 Doña Gabriela a parte de su negocio, también trabaja es empleada de una maquiladora y su esposo también trabaja, desea darle lo mejor a su familia y que sus dos hijos tenga lo necesario, un buena educación escolar. 
 Quiere invertir en su negocio y tener más variedad de productos para vender.
texts.en:
Sra. Gabriela is married and has two children. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business of selling beauty products through catalogs. Gabriela does not have the necessary funds for this investment, which will allow her to buy merchandise since she has several orders to be delivered.

In addition to this business, Doña Gabriela works as an employee at a factory where her husband also works. She wants to provide the best for her family and give her two children what they need, such as a good education.

Gabriela wants to invest in her business and have a greater variety of products to sell.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell.

loans.name: María Yolanda

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Calle América se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 6 hijos todos mayores de edad, dos de ellos que aun están solteros  vive en su casa. Su esposo es chofer.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta,  sale a vender los viernes y sabados aunque también vende  en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan una prenda, ella deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada 8 o cada quince días de acuerdo a como prefieran sus clientes. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a Guayaquil, Portoviejo o Manta cuando necesita.  Empezó su negocio con el primer crédito que recibió del banco comunal hace como 10 años, por eso está muy agradecida con la Fundación Espoir por la ayuda que le dan.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 10 años,  le gusta porque los créditos le han permitido mejorar su situación económica. 

Su sueño es tener un almacén o una boutique.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Calle América” meets every 15 days in the canton of Montecristi, which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts that are recognized on a national and international level. This place is known for its famous straw hats.

In this place, one can meet Sra. María. She is 54 years old, married, and has six grown children. Two of them are still single and live at her house. Her husband is a chauffeur.

María sells clothing of all types by going door-to-door. She sells on Fridays and Saturdays, but she also sells from her house. Her customers come to her whenever they need an article of clothing. María extends credit to her customers and collects payment every 8 or 15 days based on her customers’ preferences. She goes to Guayaquil, Portoviejo, or Manta to buy merchandise as needed.

María started this business with the first loan she received 10 years ago from the Communal Bank. For this reason, she is very grateful to Fundación ESPOIR for the help that has been given to her. This loan will be used to buy more merchandise such as trousers, blouses, t-shirts, and children’s clothes. María has been with the Communal Bank for 10 years and enjoys being a member because the loans have allowed her to improve her financial situation.

Her dream is to have a shop or a boutique.

loans.use: to buy trousers, blouses, t-shirts, and children’s clothes.

loans.name: Umi

texts.en:
Umi is applying for another loan to expand her existing business. She will use this 40,000 Kenyan shilling loan to purchase more stock of handbags and also add stock of shoes and cloth fabrics for resale. In the future, Umi aspires to continue improving her business. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Umi has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase more stock of handbags and also add stock of shoes and cloth fabrics for resale.

loans.name: Miurell Vanessa

texts.es:
La señora Miurell es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien se dedica al comercio de ropa usada desde hace 4 años negocio en el que invertirá el crédito con la compra de pacas de ropa.  Ella está casada y tiene un niño de 4 años y espera su segundo hijo.
La metas de Miurell es que su negocio crezca por eso trabaja arduamente.
texts.en:
Sra. Miurell is a hardworking and enterprising woman who has been selling used clothes for four years. She will invest this loan in the purchase of bales of clothing. Miurell is married, has a four-year-old child, and is expecting her second one.

Miurell’s goals include growing her business, which is why she works hard.

loans.use: to buy bales of clothing.

loans.name: Saimon

texts.en:
Saimon has been in the motorcycle transport business in Nakuru town for the past one year. He is 33 years old and married to Florence. They have three school-going children. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to repair and service his motorcycle and ensure it is in good condition, having experienced a higher demand in the transport business. This will also ensure stability in his transport business. 

In the future, Saimon hopes to expand his transport business by buying more motorcycles for hire and thereby increasing his income and improving his family's living standards.

loans.use: to repair and service his motorcycle

loans.name: Margarita Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Margarita del Carmen es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien es propietaria de una pulpería desde hace 10 años aproximadamente. Esta señora de 29 años está casada y tiene dos hijos una niña de 14 años y un niño de 8 años quienes le ayudan en la venta en su tiempo libre. 
El crédito que solicito es el crédito, mujer tengo derecho (autoestima)  el cual utilizara para realizarse unos exámenes y un chequeo médico.
texts.en:
Sra. Margarita del Carmen is a hardworking and enterprising woman. She has been the owner of a grocery store for approximately 10 years. Margarita is 29 years old, married, and has two children (a 14-year-old daughter and an 8-year-old son). They help her with making sales during their free time.

Margarita is requesting this loan because she has that right as a woman for her own self-esteem. She will use this loan to have some tests performed and to get a medical checkup.

loans.use: to pay for medical tests and a checkup.

loans.name: Mercedes Jakeline

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Calle América se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Mercedes tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 22, 20, 16 y 14  años de edad, todos sus hijos aun viven en su casa, el menor estudia en colegio. Su esposo es albañil. 

Ella es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudar a su marido con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días de la semana sobre todo en las mañanas ya que a estas horas se le hace más fácil realizar sus recorridos, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Empezó este negocio con el primer crédito que recibió de la institución.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa de todo tipo, perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Lleva más de 12 años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son fáciles de hacer y por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos.
 
Sus sueños son tener un local y un carro para realizar sus ventas.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Calle América” meets every 15 days in the canton of Montecristi, which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts that are recognized on a national and international level. This place is known for its famous straw hats.

In this place, one can meet Sra. Mercedes. She is 42 years old, married, and has four children (ages 22, 20, 16, and 14). All of her children still live at home and the youngest attends high school. Her husband is a bricklayer.

Mercedes is a homemaker who generates her own income so that she can help her husband with the household expenses. She sells all types of clothing and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women’s accessories). Mercedes works three days a week, mostly in the mornings because it is easier to get around during that time. She sells her products on credit and collects payment every 15 days. Mercedes started this business with the first loan she received from the organization.

This loan will be used to buy clothing of all types, perfumes, crèmes, and cosmetics. She has been with the Communal Bank for more than 12 years and enjoys being a member because the loans are easy to obtain and for the help the loans have given her. Her dreams include having her own location and a car for making sales.

loans.use: to buy clothing, perfumes, crèmes, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Bilkis

texts.en:
Bilkis is a 31-year-old married woman with two children who are enrolled in school. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provisions of the family's basic needs. She owns a house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Bilkis has operated a food stall for the past five years. Her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of establishing a new line of business in the future.

With the KSHS 40,000, she wants to purchase more stocks of rice, maize flour, wheat flour, beans and cooking oil for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase more rice, maize flour, wheat flour, beans and cooking oil

loans.name: Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
El comité “Fortaleza” se encuentra en el sexto ciclo del programa de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya, tiene 14 integrantes, de la zona de Asunción. Ellas son mujeres muy luchadoras que día a día se esfuerzan por dar lo mejor a sus familias, para que a ellos no les falte nada.
Andresa es una mujer muy trabajadora y cuenta que con mucho sacrificio ha podido ayudar a su familia y darles el sustento diario para sobrellevar el día a día. Andresa se dedica a la venta e frutas lo cual es el sustento de su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito de la fundación para la compra de frutas de estación, como ser sandía, melón, naranjas, guayabas, mangos, pomelos y demás. Agradece a la fundación por la ayuda que les está dando.
texts.en:
The group 'Fortaleza' (Strength) are currently in their sixth loan cycle in the Program for Enterprising Women of Fundación Paraguaya. It has 14 members, from the area of Asunción. They are women who daily fight to give their families the best, so they don't lack anything. 

Andresa is a hard working woman. She says that she has sacrificed a lot to be able to help her family and give them their daily bread in order to manage day by day. Andresa makes a living selling fruit, which is her families sustenance.

She is requesting a loan from the Fundación to buy seasonal fruits such as watermelon, melon, oranges, guava, mango, grapefruit and others.

She is grateful to the Fundación for the help they are receiving.

loans.use: to buy watermelons, melons, oranges, guavas, mangos, grapefruit and others.

loans.name: Yadira De Los Angeles

texts.es: Yadira De los Ángeles ha venido trabajando con Fundación León 2000, otorgándole el crédito para invertir en el negocio. Ella nos cuenta que actualmente su negocio va muy bien ya que tiene nuevos clientes que la visita por la calidad de servicio que le brinda. El crédito anterior los utilizo para aumentar su capital trabajo ya tiene muchas demanda su servicio. Yadira esta nuevamente solicitando financiamiento para la compra de productos para el negocio como granos básicos,   carne, verduras, bolsas, utensilios para cocina entre otros
texts.en:
Yadira De los Ángeles has been working with Fundación León 2000, after receiving a loan to invest in her business. She tells us that her business is presently doing very well. She has new customers who come to her for the quality of the service that she offers. Her previous loan was used to increase her work capital and her service is now is high demand. 

Yadira is requesting another loan to buy products for her business such as basic grains, meat, vegetables, bags, cooking utensils and other items.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, meat, vegetables, bags, cooking utensils and other items.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married lady. She has four children who depend on her. She has been farming for a period of six years.

She learned about KADET LTD through other women registered in her area of residence. She paid her previous loan successfully without complication. This is her third loan from KADET LTD.

She wants to use the loan to buy farm supplies such as wheat seeds and fertilizer and to hire manpower to aid on the farm. She hopes to grow different crops on her farm and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
This is Alicia, 55, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Alberto, her business partner, and she is a mother to her two children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Alicia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Alicia hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products to sell

loans.name: Sren

texts.en:
Mrs. Sren, age 40, is a mother of five single children, living in Kompong Cham province. To earn a living, she works together with her husband on their inherited farmlands. She earns approximately $1.50 per day. However, the income is not balanced with her daily expenses and the family condition is not so good. Presently, two of her children work in a garment factory in Phnom Penh city and they get a salary of $80 each. 

Mrs. Sren wants to borrow this loan to purchase a used motorcycle to satisfy her family and to avoid the expenditure on transportation fees. For her prospect, Sren hopes to build a strong farming business and expand her farmland, thereby increasing her output and household income.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle for her family

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is a 52-year-old business lady. She is married to Mwanzia who is a farmer. They are blessed with three children.  She has been selling scrap metal for the past one year with a monthly income of KES 5,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her fourth loan with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. Damaris will use the loan to buy more metals for her business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop.

loans.use: To buy more metals for her business

loans.name: Lorena De Los Angeles

texts.es: Lorena es una emprendedora que inicio su  negocio con capital propio se arriesgo a pesar de que no sabía mucho de el, hoy en día ya sabe que piden sus clientes que la visitan. Ella es clienta activa de Fundación León 2000, el acredito que se otorgo anterior fue para invertir en el negocio en la compra de capital trabajo. Actualmente está solicitando financiamiento para invertir  en el negocio en la compra de variedad de producto para el negocio.
texts.en:
Lorena is an enterprising woman who started a business with her own capital. She took this risk despite not knowing much about this business. Nowadays she has many customers and she is familiar with their demands. She is a client of Fundación León 2000. The previous loan she received was used to invest in her business with work capital. 

She is now requesting a loan to invest in buying a variety of products for her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials such as Indian fabrics, canvas, embroidery threads and sewing threads to increase production.

loans.name: Yadira Sonia

texts.es: Yadira Sonia tiene 44 años de edad, el negocio en el se dedica destace de cerdos, ella nos cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de su mama que ella realizaba esta actividad, posteriormente Yadira se dedica a esta actividad, surge la idea porque necesitaba apoyar a su esposo en los gastos de la familia. Yadira Sonia está solicitando financiamiento para la compra de cerdos para destazarlo y ventar la carne.
texts.en:
Yadira Sonia is 44 years old. She makes a living in the pig business. She tells us that she learnt this business from her mother as she also carried out this activity. Later, Yadira also began in this activity. The idea came about because she needed to support her husband in the household bills.

Yadira Sonia is requesting a loan to buy pigs to butcher and sell the meat.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
This is Marilou, she is 33 and a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Jacor, a carpenter, and mother to her two children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Marilou operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5 worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 800 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Marilou hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a married woman. She has three children, whose ages range from six to nineteen years old. 
She describes herself as humble and friendly. Monica operates a retail store where she sells maize. She has been involved in this business for two years. 

Her business is located within her home area and her primary customers are neighbors and passersby. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the varying price of maize. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase more maize to sell. 

Monica's business goal is to run another maize-selling retail store in a nearby town within five years.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of maize.

loans.name: Jose Octaviano

texts.es:
Jose Octaviano es un señor de 48 años de edad, el cual vive con su familia, en una comunidad llamada el Upala de San Carlos, en la provincia de Alajuela. En Alajuela existen cinco parques nacionales, una reserva nacional de fauna silvestre, cinco zonas protectoras y varias reservas forestales. También en la provincia se ubica el Museo Juan Santamaría, el cual exhibe artesanías producidas localmente. Esta zona ocupa el primer lugar nacional en la producción de café y azúcar de caña.
Desde hace tres años que Jose Octaviano se dedica a la ganadería, ya que cuenta en estos momentos con una finca, pero le falta lo principal para que su negocio surja y para que los vecinos de su comunidad se vean beneficiados. 
Actualmente Jose Octaviano está solicitando un micro crédito de ¢500.000 (quinientos mil colones) para la compra de cuatro novillas. Con esto el espera hacer crecer su negocio y mejorar tanto su calidad de vida como la de su familia. 

Jose Octaviano es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Delirio, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su tercer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Jose Octaviano is 48 years old. He lives with his family in a community called El Upala de San Carlos, in the province of Alajuela. In Alajuela there are five national parks, a national wildlife reserve, five protected areas and various forest reserves. The Juan Santamaría Museum is also in the area, where locally prodcued artesanal products are on display. This zone is the nation's top producer of coffee and sugar cane. 

For the last three years Jose Octaviano has made a living in cattle farming. He has a farm but is lacking the most important part which will cause his business to get ahead and will help to benefit the community.

At this time, Jose Octaviano is requesting a loan of 500,000 colones to buy four heifers. With this he hopes to make his business grow and improve his and his family's quality of life.

Jose Octaviano is a member of the company 'Crédito Comunal de Delirio', one of the 150 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his third loan and with it he hopes to continue growing personally and economically, apart from participating actively in the MFI of his community.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Otgonkhuu

texts.en:
Mr. Otgonkhuu is 23 and a taxi driver. He has been running his taxi service since he got his driver's license.
He lives with his mother in Kherlen, a boundary town of western Mongolia. Initially, he started his taxi service with his dad’s car, but now he owns a new car, which has been bought with his earnings. 

He already has permanent customers from his taxi line and now he needs to renovate his car to give a better service to his customers. It will form a part of his business improvement. 
The loan he is taking will be dedicated to the purchase of necessary spare parts for his taxi renovation.

loans.use: To purchase the necessary spare parts for his taxi renovation.

loans.name: Kaseni

texts.en:
Kaseni is a 42-year-old married woman with four children, who are enrolled in school. Her husband is a businessman, who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. 
She owns a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Kaseni has operated a motorbike transportation business for the past two years; her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge from accidents that result in expensive bike repairs. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Ksh 40,000, she wants to purchase spare parts and pay for her motorbike's maintainance. She decided to join Yehu because they offer quality financial services.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts and pay for her motorbike's maintainance.

loans.name: Noemi Abigal

texts.es:
Noemi tiene 42 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos los cuales ha criado sola con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio pero por lo cual ella está muy orgullosa, Noemí vive en casa de su madre, la cual tiene 73 años de edad y a la cual apoya con el fruto de su trabajo ya que por su edad requiere cuidados especiales y ella lo hace con mucho gusto, Noemí es una mujer humildad de muy buen carácter.

Noemí trabaja en su negocio de venta de abarrotes desde hace 4 años, su negocio se encuentra en su casa, en un dia puede atender hasta 20 clientes en el día, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque atiende muy bien a los clientes ya que le gusta que las personas hablen del buen trato que ella brinda y asi mas clientes vienen a buscarla para comprar sus productos, pero también porque Dios la protege y la ayuda a hacer las cosas con honradez y respeto a los demás.

Noemí está muy agradecida con los ´prestatarios Kiva ya que con su ayuda ella podrá comprar más mercadería en especial útiles escolares ya que esta pronto el inicio de las clases en los colegios, con esta mejora tendrá mas variedad de productos y tendrá mayores mas ingresos  para mejorar su calidad de vida y poder seguir ahorrando para cumplir su gran sueño:” Tener su Casa propia”.
texts.en:
Noemi is 42 years old. She has four children, who she brought up alone with a lot of hard work and sacrifice, although she is very proud of this. Noemi lives in her mother's house, who is 73 years old. She supports her with the fruit of her work. Due to her age, she requires special care, which Noemi provides eagerly. Noemi is a humble woman of good character.

Noemi has worked in her grocery store for the last four years. Her business is set up in her house and in one day she can serve up to 20 customers during the day. She believes that her business is doing well because she serves customers well and she likes her customers to talk of the good service she provides. In this way more customers will come to buy her products. In addition, she believes that God protects and helps her to do things honestly and with respect for others.

Noemi is very grateful to Kiva. With their help she will be able to buy more stock, especially school items, as the school classes soon begin. With this she will have a wider variety of products and will have a higher income to improve her quality of life and continue saving to fulfil her greatest dream: To have her own house.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel has operated his cake baking business in the town of Ndunyu Njeru for the past year. 
He is 58 years old, married to Esther and they have two children. The cake baking business is his primary activity, his other source of income is farming.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more baking flour and cooking oil for use in his bakery.

In the future, Daniel hopes to expand his bakery business and become one of the best cake sellers and distributers in Ndunyu Njeru town.

loans.use: To buy more flour and oil for baking

loans.name: Cristo Salvador Group

texts.es: La Sra. Maria  es divorciada, tiene 36 años de edad  actualmente es integrante en la alcancía comunal “Cristo Salvador” grupo  conformado por 5  socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio.  maria trabaja desde hace 6  años en la venta de ajis y pelandolos en el mercado. Este negocio surge a raiz de su divorcio ya que ella tenia que mantener a sus tres hijos, es asi que trabajo muy duro para obtener mayores ingresos,con el tiempo cuenta con clientes fidelizados y su negocio mejora, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación a logrado mejores ingresos económicos, poco apoco fue comprando cosas para su hogar y sobre todo su familia cuenta con una mejor calidad de vida,  con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar insumos es decir ajis  .Sabemos que maria  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran
texts.en:
Maria is 36 years old. She is divorced and is presently a member of the communal bank "Cristo Salvador". This group is formed of five members who make a living in diverse business activities. Maria has worked peeling and selling Aji in the market for the last six years. 

This business came about due to her divorce as she had to provide for her three children. So, she works hard to obtain a higher income. With time, she now has loyal customers and her business is improving. Thanks to her effort and dedication she has achieved a better economic income. Little by little she started buying things for her house and above all so that her family can have a better quality of life. 

In order to continue extending her business, he is requesting a new loan to buy Aji. We know that Maria will achieve her goals with hard work, effort and the help of the loans from Edaprospo.

loans.use: to buy Aji to peel and sell.

loans.name: Hakiligouma Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe HAKILIGOUMA composé de femmes mariées qui ont en moyenne d’âge de 32 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leur maris, frères, sœurs, coépouse et enfants. Elles résident dans le village de SIDO, préfecture de Bougouni (3ème région administrative du Mali).
Dans le souci d’augmenter les ressources financières et de diversifier leurs activités, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso où elles sont à leurs troisièmes prêts. Tous les deux prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de légumes, de céréales et des produits de beauté.
FATOUMATA, la présidente du groupe est à l’extrême droite sur la photo, elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 50 bouteilles de pommade, 100 paquets de mèche et bien d’autre types de produits cosmétiques (vernis, crème, déodorant). Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Bamako auprès des grossistes. Elle vend au  grand marché de SIDO et à domicile à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, en détail, au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle  compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  dans l’éducation et la santé des enfants et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en: Members of the HAKILIGOUMA group are married women who are on average 32 years old and have three children each.  They live in traditional extended families with their husbands, brothers, sisters, co-wives and children.  They are residents of the village of Sido, located in the Bougouni prefecture (third administrative district of Mali).  In order to increase their financial resources and to diversify their activities, they have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are requesting their third loan.  Their two previous loans were well repaid.  Members of the group are involved in the sale of vegetables, grains and beauty products.  Fatoumata, the group's facilitator, is on the far right in the photo.  With this loan, she plans to buy 50 tubes of ointment, 100 packs of hair extensions and many other cosmetic products (nail polish, lotion, deodorant).  She buys her goods from wholesalers at the Grand Marché in Bamako.  She sells them for retail from home and at the Grand Marché in Sido, to male and female customers who pay her cash or on credit.  She is expecting average monthly profits to reach 35,000 CFA francs, part of which will be used to pay for her children's education and healthcare, while the rest will be invested in her activities.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES UNIDAS”, la socia es  natural de la ciudad del Cusco.

La socia Bertha tiene 27 años de edad es casada y tiene 2 hijos, La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con  la administración y atencion de su pequeño restaurante, la socia tiene un restaurante que ella misma lo administra y cocina junto con la ayuda de algunos familiares ella prepara diversos potajes para la venta diaria, la socia desea en esta ocasión invertir el prestamo en la compra de arroz, aceite, sal, fideos entre otros ingredientes que salen a diario para la elaboracion de sus diferentes menus, la socia desea comprar al por mayor para economizar y mejorar sus vetas. La socia solicita el prestamo para comprar arroz, aceite, fideos entre otros productos.


La socia agradece y expresa su satisfacción de poder seguir creciendo con su negocio propio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago  de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "MUJERES UNIDAS" and is from the city of Cusco.

Bertha, 27, is married and has two children.  She alternates her daily household activities with her management and attention to a small restaurant she runs together with some relatives.  She prepares different stews for daily sale.  She wants to use the loan to buy rice, oil, salt and other ingredients she needs daily to make the different menu items.  Buying products wholesale will improve her sales.

She is very grateful and expresses her satisfaction at being able to continue expanding her business.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy rice, oil, noodles and other items, wholesale.

loans.name: Pochita

texts.es: Pochita, de 37 años es una mujer valiente y perseverante, trabaja mucho y se esfuerza para poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus cuatro menores hijos. Ella vive en su casa propia en compañía de su pareja y sus hijos. El trabajo de Pochita consiste en la venta de comida, todos los días sale a las calles a vender comida, negocio que lo ha ejercido por más de cuatro años y se siente muy cómoda ya que le esta yendo muy bien en el negocio. Del mismo modo le gusta lo que hace ya que le da puede dedicar unas horas sin descuidar de su familia, además del capital que percibe puede ayudar a su pareja con los gastos de hogar. ahora ella tiene muchos proyectos en mente y desea realizarlos todos, pero por ahora solo espera seguir trabajando mucho para seguir contribuyendo a mejorar la economía de su familia y mas adelante poner un restaurante. Este será el crédito número cuatro con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financieros y así aumentar su capital de trabajo, por otro lado se compromete una vez mas de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo, esta muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos son muy responsables y solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará ingredientes más insumos para seguir con su trabajo de venta de comida.
texts.en:
Pochita, 37, is a courageous, determined woman who works hard and makes every effort to give her four minor children the best lifestyle she can.  She lives in her own house with her common-law husband and children.  Pochita sells food for a living, and works as a street vendor every day.  She has been in business for four years and is very comfortable because it is going well; and she enjoys the fact that she can work without neglecting the family.  With the income she receives she is able to help her husband cover household expenses.  Now she has many projects in mind and wants to carry them all out, but for now she only hopes to continue working so she can contribute to the family economy.  In the future she wants to establish a restaurant.

This is her fourth loan through MFP and she is content knowing she can count on this financial support and increase her working capital.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time, as with the previous loans.  She enjoys her communal bank because all the members are responsible and supportive.  With the 1,500 PEN loan she plans to buy ingredients and supplies for her food business.

loans.use: To buy food ingredients.

loans.name: Unión Progreso Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “UNIÓN PROGRESO” iniciará su segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Germán Busch, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Basilia. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de comida, salchipapa, venta de fruta, venta de fresco, venta de verduras, taller de chapería, venta de engranes, venta de pasteles.

La señora Basilia,  indica que hace dos años que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una amiga. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido en macramé a mantas que viene trabajando hace años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de tela) que comprará de La Paz  y posteriormente a la elaboración lo venderá en las ferias y otros departamentos. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito.
texts.en:
The communal bank "UNIÓN PROGRESO" is in its second cycle of the Pro Mujer program at the Germán Busch social center.  The group is comprised of eight members and the board of directors is chaired by Mrs. Basilia.  The communal bank's members all have different businesses, among which are sales of food sales, fruit, softdrinks, vegetables, ornamental metal plates, mesh and pastry.

Basilia has been working with Pro Mujer for two years and she joined the institution by invitation from a friend.  She has a macramé blanket business which she has been in for several years.

The loan she is requesting is to increase her working capital to buy fabric in La Paz.  She will then sell her finished products at markets in other departments.  This type of work allows her to generate an income to support her family.  She lives with her common-law husband and three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says it is the loan program.

loans.use: To buy fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase maize and beans for selling.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
This is Josephine, 40, resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Leonido, a security guard, and is a mother to her child. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Josephine operates a tailoring business. She mainly offers curtains, bed sheets, blankets, and other home trappings. Seasonal demands for clothing like uniforms and such are available all year round. She also does repairs and alterations. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 13,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other items needed in her business. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.  

Josephine hopes her business grows and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. Every week she faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials she needs in her business.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura tiene 29 años de edad y vive con su familia en una comunidad llamada Brasilia, en la provincia de Alajuela. Por esa área se da mucho el turismo por motivo del Volcán Arenal ubicado en sus cercanías, con el bosque nubloso de Monteverde y las tierras bajas del norte del país. En Alajuela existen cinco parques nacionales, una reserva nacional de fauna silvestre, cinco zonas protectoras y varias reservas forestales. También en la provincia se ubica el Museo Juan Santamaría, el cual exhibe artesanías producidas localmente. Esta zona ocupa el primer lugar nacional en la producción de café y azúcar de caña.

Desde el 2009 Laura se dedica a su negocio y se cerró por falta de recursos económicos. Ella tiene una librería/bazar, se ofrece servicio de librería, fotocopiado, artículos de bazar y próximamente BN servicios. Brinda sus servicios a los vecinos de la comunidad, quienes se muestran muy satisfechos por la calidad.

Actualmente Laura está solicitando un microcrédito de 400,000.00 (cuatrocientos mil colones), para la compra de materiales y también para reparar su impresora, ya que quiere darles a sus clientes una mejor calidad de servicio, necesita solventar y tener otro ingreso económico para su hogar. 

Laura es miembro de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Brasilia S.A, razón por la cual está  muy agradecida por las oportunidades  de acceso al crédito que esta le brinda y poder llevar a cabo sus proyectos de vida.
texts.en:
Laura, 29, lives with her family in a community called Brasilia in the province of Alajuela.  There is much tourism in this area because of the Arenal volcano located in the nearby Monteverde cloud forest in the lowlands in the northern part of the country.  There are five national parks in Alajuela, a national wildlife preserve, five protected areas and several forest reserves.  In the province there is also the Juan Santamaría Museum which exhibits locally produced crafts.  The region is also the top coffee and cane sugar producer.

Since 2009 Laura has been in business but had to close because a lack of economic resources.  She has a printing/bazaar business where she offers printing services, photocopying, bazaar articles and, in the future, Internet services.  Her customers are the community neighbors who are very satisfied with her quality.

Laura is requesting a micro-loan of 400,000 CRC to buy supplies and repair a printer.  She wants to provide the best customer service possible and must provide an additional income for the household.

Laura is a member of the communal bank Brasilia S.A., and she is very grateful for the opportunity to have access to a loan which will help her meet her goals.

loans.use: To buy supplies and repair a printer.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 48 años, es una mujer amable y muy alegre. Está casada con Elvis de 47 años, y es el padre de sus cinco hijos a quienes crió y educo con esmero y esfuerzo. Ahora los tres son mayores e independientes y solo vive con dos de ellos en su casa propia junto a su pareja. El trabajo de Rosa tiene como fin el de solucionar los problemas mecánicos y eléctricos de los transportistas, ella tiene un taller de mecánica que se encarga de administrar. Su taller está en su casa y ahí llegan a diario muchos transportistas en busca de que le solucionen los desperfectos de sus vehículos, ahí quien se encarga de componer los vehículos es su pareja y ella solo se encarga de emitir las boletas y facturas. Hace quince año que empezaron juntos en éste negocio,  desde entonces crecieron mucho ya que empezaron con un taller de vulcanizado y ahora tienen su taller de mecánica. Le esta yendo muy bien ya que tiene buenos clientes y como toda persona tiene muchas metas aun por alcanzar, pero lo que desea por ahora es poder ampliar su taller. Este será el crédito numero 5 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá más segura de poder avanzar con su trabajo, por otro lado se compromete una vez mas en cumplir con sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo, además está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos sus integrantes son personas buenas, amables y muy responsables. Con el monto solicitado 3000 soles, comprará materiales y herramientas para poder continuar brindando el servicio de mecánica en su taller.
texts.en:
Rosa, 48, is a kind, cheerful woman who is married to Elvis, 47.  They have five children who they raised with much care and effort.  All three are now adults and independent, and only two are still living at home.  Rosa's work involves solving mechanical and electrical problems for transport vehicles.  She has a workshop that she runs out of her house.  Every day many drivers seek her out to fix their vehicles.  Her husband is the mechanic and she takes care of the paperwork and invoices.  They began the business 15 years ago and since then have been growing significantly with their vulcanization shop and, now, mechanical shop.  

Business is going very well because they have good customers.  But like everyone, she has goals and wants to expand the workshop.  This is her fifth loan through MFP.  She is very content with the financial support because she is confident she will be able to progress in the business.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time, as with the previous loans.  She is happy with her communal bank because all the members are good, kind and very responsible.  The 3000 PEN loan will be used to buy materials and tools to continue providing excellent service at her workshop.

loans.use: To buy materials and tools for her workshop.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda is 30 years old and the single mother of one child aged 14 years. She has been running a salon for the past five years with the monthly income of about KES 5,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET LTD. Rhoda will use the loan to buy a blow dryer and a hair dryer. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her child. Her hopes and dreams are to add cosmetics to her shop.

loans.use: To buy a blow dryer and a hair dryer.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a 39-year-old farmer. She is married to Peter, who is a businessman. They are blessed with one child aged 20 years. She has been raising poultry for the past three years with the monthly income of about KES 10,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan term from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Helen will use the loan to buy chicken feed and more chicks. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her child. Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and venture into mixed crop farming.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed and more chicks.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 52 años, es una mujer muy buena, amable y trabajadora. Está casada con Geiner de 54 años con quien tiene cinco hijos de los cuales ya tres son mayores e independientes mientras que Grimen de 20 y Kelvir de 17 años viven aun con ellos y los apoya en sus estudios. Ella vive a lado de su familia en una casa propia que logró obtenerla a base de esfuerzo y sacrificio. Rosa tiene como trabajo el recorrer muchos lugares de la región, en su transitar se va realizando diferentes ventas de productos o intercambios con algunos otros, es así que lleva ropa nueva y de segunda y los vende o intercambiar con animales o frutos de temporada. Asimismo con los productos que obtiene los vende en el mercado en donde obtiene buenas ganancias. Tiene más de 10 años realizando está actividad, y manifiesta que le gusta pues le permite tener tiempo para su hogar, además de los ingresos que percibe. Ahora tiene un buen mercado en donde vender y comprar y espera mas adelante instalar un local en donde pueda vender otros tipos de productos y así estar mas tranquila en un solo lugar. Este será el crédito número dos con MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Con el monto solicitado 2500 soles, comprará más mercadería además de invertirlo en la compra de algunos productos que le proveen sus clientes.
texts.en: Rosa is 52 years old. She is a kind, friendly and hardworking woman. She is married to Geiner, who is  54 years old. They have five children, three of whom are grown and independent, while Grimen, 20, and Kelvir, 17, still live with them and are supported in their studies. She lives with her family in her own house that she obtained with hard work and sacrifice. Rosa's work is going to many different places in the area selling and trading different products. She takes new and used clothing and sells or exchanges it for animals or seasonal fruit. She sells the products she obtains in the market, where she makes good profit. She has been doing this activity for more than 10 years and she says that she likes it because it allows her to have time at home, aside form the income she makes. Now she has a good market where she buys and sells and she hopes to open a locale in the future where she can sell other types of products and be a little calmer in one place. This will be her second loan with MFP, and she hopes to have a small loan to achieve her goals. With the 2500 soles that she has asked for, she will buy more merchandise and invest in some products that she provides for her customers.

loans.use: to buy more clothes.

loans.name: Beatric

texts.en: Beatrice is 22 years old and lives in Gardnersville, She is single and has two children, 4 and 11 years old. For the past five years she has been selling fresh fish on a table in the market. She started this business with money given to her by her mother. She’s requesting a loan to purchase fresh bonnie fish (a small, freshwater fish) for her business. She would like to enlarge her business and run her own shop.

loans.use: to purchase fresh bonnie fish for her business.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly has operated her beauty salon in Nakuru town for the last seven years.  She is 34 years old and married to George, and they have one child.
