She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our existing clients, and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more beauty products, oils and salon equipment for use in her beauty salon.

In future, Nelly hopes to expand and fully equip her salon so as to attract more customers and make more income, thereby improving her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products, oils and salon equipment.

loans.name: Darlyn

texts.en:
This is Darlyn, 38, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Bejamine, a vendor, and is a mother of five children. She and her husband share responsibility in attending to their young children while at the same time earning an income for their daily needs. 

Darlyn is a Balut vendor. In the Philippines, Balut is a well-known egg that is sold on the sidewalk. It is a fertilized duck egg that has not been hatched. Instead it is cooked as a boiled egg with a delicious small amount of soup inside. It is a highly nutritious food that Filipinos love to eat, especially when they feel tired, as it revitalizes their energy and strength. About 450-600 Balut eggs are boiled and sold every night. She and her husband do the selling to lessen expenses of paying commissions to vendors that will sell the eggs. They earn about 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales per day.  

Darlyn is requesting a loan amounting to Php 12,000 that she will use as start-up capital for her additional business, which is selling quail eggs and fried chicken skin. The remaining amount will be spent on purchasing additional Balut eggs. There is a high demand for fried chicken skin, and she wants to give it a try since her stall is located in a crowded and busy area. 

Darlyn dreams of having a stall located in the market. She still has to wait a little bit more to make this come true because she has to prioritize being a mother to her young children. For now, Darlyn and her husband will just continue to lean on each other to make their small business grow for the sake of their children’s future. Darlyn never fails to attend weekly fellowship* meetings as they inspire her to go on with their life no matter what the obstacles are, because she has a big God Who will never fail her. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of Balut and to add new food items to her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add more books for resale.

loans.name: Zoljargal

texts.en: Mr. Zoljargal, 26, works as driver in the state organization. He lives with his family in Kherlen, a boundary town of western Mongolia. His wife, Soyoltsetseg, runs a tailoring business in a rented shop. Since 2008 she has been running her business with her husband and already has many permanent customers. She has hired 2 other sewers and they always have a high workload. Next month her tailoring shop will be expanded by one other employee. It will be part of their business improvement.  Due to this they need to purchase a new sewing machine with double-cross stitching capability. The loan Zoljargal is taking will be used to purchase a new sewing machine for expanding his wife’s tailoring shop.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine for expanding his wife’s tailoring shop.

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en: Fridah is a widowed woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 8 years to 22 years. She describes herself to be a diligent, responsible and aggressive woman. She operates a retail store where she sells detergents. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a populated area and her primary customers are residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the low purchasing power from customers due to the low awareness on the sale of detergents. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase more detergents for washing. Fridah's business goal is to own a detergent selling company within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy more washing detergents for selling.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 47 year old farmer.  She is married to Danston who is a business man.  They are blessed with one child aged 20.  She has been rearing poultry for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 10,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan term with KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member.  Esther will use the loan to buy chicken feed and more chicks. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her child.  Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and venture into mixed crop farming.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed and more chicks to rear for sale.

loans.name: Chhim

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhim is a local rice farmer from Kompong Cham province.  She has been engaged in her business for more than 11 years.  She is an experienced cultivator.  Even so, she usually performs her tasks by using traditional methods, which she learned from her ancestors.  She typically earns an average of $ 3.00 each day to support her living expenses.  She is now 38 years old and has been blessed with two school-age kids. 

The purpose of this loan is to buy mineral fertilizers and to pay for laborer for transplanting her dry-season rice.  She is very happy for the loan given to her since it would allow her to performa her micro farming project.  She hopes that she will be able to increase her output.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers and to pay for laborer for transplanting her dry-season rice.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 23 years old and lives in Gardnersville.  She is married and her husband is a teacher.  They have a child aged 4, live at home and go to school.   Alice  has been selling slippers for the past eight years.  She started this business with her own saving.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase more goods (slippers) for her  business.  Her plan is to become an international businesswoman.

loans.use: To purchase more goods (slippers) for her  business.

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice is a forty four year old lady from Siaya town, which is in the western part of Kenya.  She is married to Musa and they have five children between the ages of six and 18 years old.

Joice operates a clothing business in Siaya Market, a business she has done for the last 10 years.  She makes a monthly income of KES 18,000. 

Joice is taking her first loan from KADET LTD which she will use to two bales of clothing for sale.  She will use profits to expand her business and also improve her family's living standards.  Her dream is to open a salon and boutique in Siaya town.

loans.use: To buy bales of  used clothing for sale.

loans.name: Jemima

texts.en:
Jemima is a widowed woman.  She has 3 children with ages ranging from 22 years to 28 years.  She describes herself to be an aggressive and humble woman.  She operates a retail store where she sells detergents.  She has been involved in this business for 3 years.  Her business is located in a populated area and her primary customers are residents. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be low purchasing power from customers due to low awareness about the sale of detergents.  She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase more detergents for washing.  Jemima's business goal is to own a detergent selling company within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy more detergents to sell.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a thirty two year old man from Kakamega town, situated in the Western part of Kenya and is married to Juliet and they have two children aged one and two years.

Moses has been operating a welding business for the last seven years in Kakamega town where he makes a monthly income of KES 5,000. 

He is taking his first loan from KADET LTD which he will use to buy welding metals and other items.  He will use his profits to boost his business.  His dream is to have a successful welding business in Kakamega town.

loans.use: To buy welding materials.

loans.name: Oyun

texts.en:
Oyun is 48 years old, a widowed woman who lives with her 3 children in Hentii province in Eastern Mongolia.  One of them studies at the secondary school in the local area, and the oldest one is independent from the family and works as a hairdresser in Ulaanbaatar.  

She has been running a meat and raw materials retailing business in the renting shop counter of the local market since 2005. Based on her experience, she would like to extend the business activity in her well positioned shop counter.  She is an independent and intelligent woman who says that "I would like to extend my business to raise some money and for my daughters studies".  The total amount she is requesting is 1,000,000 MNT for the supplies, such as meat and livestock hides.

loans.use: To purchase meat and livestock hides.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 34 year old business man.  He is married to Hannah, a farmer.  They are blessed with two children.  He has been in the motorcycle transport business for the past ten years with a monthly income of KES 6,500 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his third loan term after repaying the previous loans successfully.  Joseph will use the loan to buy spare parts for his motorbike.

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children.  His hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his motorbike.

loans.name: Oudoucar 02 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Oudoucar 02  a été créé le 30 Mai 2008  à l’inauguration de leur banc villageois. Il est composé de 29 femmes qui sont issues du même village. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Lyssa (assise à l’extrême droite) est responsable de groupe, elle est âgée de 52 ans. Elle est  mariée trois enfants.

Elle est vendeuse de fruits et légumes dans sa localité, activé qu’elle mène depuis son adhésion dans le système.

Son nouveau lui permettra de s’approvisionner en légumes pour la revente.

Elle compte soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge des enfants.
texts.en: Oudoucar 02 Group was established on May 30, 2008, when the Banc Villageois was inaugurated. It is made up of 29 women coming from the same village. Their main business is retail. Mrs. Lyssa, sitting on the far right in the photograph, is responsible for the group. She's 52 years old, married, and has three children. She sells fruits and vegetables in her village, a business she's been running since she joined the system. Her new loan will enable her to replenish her stock of vegetable to resell. She intends to help her husband take care of the children.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to resell

loans.name: Beatridah

texts.en:
Beatridah is a 29 year single lady with no dependant.  She has been in the sales of safaricom cards for the past six years and earns a monthly income of KES 19,000 from the business. 

She is requesting for a loan worth KES 30,000 to pay her debts and purchase more cards.  The profit made from the business will help her repay her loan and expand her business. 

Her dream is to open different kinds of businesses that would sustain her.

loans.use: To purchase more airtime cards.

loans.name: Arkadya

texts.en:
Arkadya is 37 years old. He lives in Ijevan with his wife and two children, a daughter and a son, both of whom attend school. 

Arkadya is a mechanical engineer, but he works at a gas station. His wife works at a confectionery workshop. Arkadya says that their salaries aren’t enough to provide for their family, so Arkadya and his wife run a farm business as well. 

Arkadya and his wife grow fruits and vegetables for their family's use. Also, they breed pigs and chickens, and produce pork and eggs, which Arkadya sells from his house. 

Thanks to farming, Arkadya provides his family with fresh produce and thanks to the income from the agricultural business, he provides his family with a necessary subsistence.

This is Arkadya’s second loan from Nor Horizon and now he needs a 1000000 AMD loan to buy a new sort sow and also a large lot of fodder for his farm animals for the winter months.

loans.use: to buy a new sort sow and also a large lot of fodder for his farm animals for the winter months.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married woman.  She has a daughter who is 1 year old.  She describes herself to be deligent and humble.  

She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables and fruits.  She has been involved in this business for 4 years.  Her business is located near a busy road and her primary customers are residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be storage problems as they are perishable. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase more vegetables and fruits.  Her business goal is to own a permanent place of operation for the grocery store activity within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Oudoucar 01 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Oudoucar 01  a été créé le 30 Mai 2008  à l’inauguration de leur banc villageois. Il est composé de 16 femmes qui sont issues du même village. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Assise  à l’extrême  droite, madame Gassama est responsable du groupe, elle est âgée de 58 ans. Elle est  veuve et prend en charge 10 de ses enfants. 

Elle est  vendeuse de savon, arachide et divers produits de sa localité. Elle a  une bonne expérience dans ce domaine pour l’avoir pratiqué plus de six années. Au par avant elle pratiquait la culture saisonnière.

Ce nouveau crédit lui permettra de s’approvisionner en savon et divers produits en détail pour la revente.

Avec les bénéfices qu’elle tirera de son activité, elle compte améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants.
texts.en: Oudoucar 01 Group was established on May 30, 2008, when the Banc Villageois was inaugurated. It is made up of 16 women coming from the same village. Their main business is retail. Mrs. Gassama, sitting on the far right, is responsible for the group. She's 58 years old, a widow, and has to support ten of her children. She resells soap, peanuts, and various other products in her village. She has a good experience in this field, due to the fact that she's been running this business for more than six years. Previously, she was a seasonal cultivator. This new loan will enable her to buy soap and various other products to retail. With her profits, she intends to improve the standard of living of her children.

loans.use: to buy soap and other products to retail

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
La formación del presente comité fue gracias a una de las miembros, quien se animó a trabajar en grupo luego de conocer el programa de la Fundación y contactó con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en la zona. El comité se denomina Nueva Esperanza, están en el Tercer Ciclo con 12  integrantes. Es un grupo muy unido, solidario y responsable.
Jorgelina tiene una peluquería modesta, pero bien equipada y nos cuenta que tiene muy buena clientela siempre, ya que ella atiende con simpatía y de buena forma a todas sus clientas y clientes. Ella desea poder ampliar su negocio, y, algún día, poder dar fuentes de empleo a otras personas.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de shampoo, enjuagues, esmaltes de uñas, tijeras, peines y demás insumos para utilizar en su peluquería. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
This committee was formed through to the efforts of one member, who was encouraged to work in a group after getting to know about the Foundation's program. She contacted her neighbors and friends to form a committee in their area. The committee is called Nueva Esperanza (New Hope), which consists of 12 members. They are now in the third cycle. It is a close-knit group, and the members are supportive and responsible.

Jorgelina has a beauty salon, which is small but well equipped. She tells us that she has always had very good customers, as she gives friendly and quality service to all of her clients. She wants to expand her business, and to be able to employ others someday.

Jorgelina has applied for this loan to purchase shampoo, mouthwash, nail polish, scissors, combs and other supplies to use in her salon. She is grateful to the foundation and to Kiva for the opportunity she is receiving.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, mouthwash, nail polish, scissors, combs and other supplies for the salon.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en: Fredrick is a 28-year-old married man. He has two children, 2 years old and 4 years old. He describes himself as self-motivated, skilled and a risk taker. He operates a retail business. He has been involved in this business for one year. His primary customers are middle income earners. He describes his biggest business challenge to be weather, especially the hot season as the business is in an open air area. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase more clothes to sell. In the next five years, Fredrick's hope and dream is to have  a big boutique.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle for her husband.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine is a 48-year-old widowed woman with three children. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Josphine has operated a retail stall for the past 3 years; her potential clients are her relatives and friends. She faces a major challenge of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 80,000 she wants to purchase more onions, tomatoes, potatoes and snacks for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more onions, tomatoes, potatoes and snacks for resale.

loans.name: Mujeres De Cerro Real Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son de Cerro Real de la cuidad de Caacupé. Las señoras están muy satisfechas con el apoyo de la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva, ellas están en el ciclo Nº  1 con sus 12 integrantes.
Juana es una persona muy trabajadora y nos cuenta que por medio de la venta de bebidas que tiene ha logrado mantener a su familia y darles lo que necesitan para una vida sin privaciones ni necesidades. Ella se define como una persona muy sacrificada y emprendedora.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de cervezas, vinos, gaseosas, y demás tipos de bebidas, ya que tiene muchos pedidos siempre y no quiere quedarse sin stock de ellas.
texts.en:
The women belonging to this communal bank are from Cerro Real in the city of Caacupé. The ladies are very satisfied with the support they have received from the Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva. There are 12 members and they are currently in the first cycle. 

Juana is a hard worker and tells us that by selling drinks, she has managed to provide for her family and give them what they need for a life that is free from want and need. She defines herself as a very self-sacrificing and enterprising woman. Juana has applied for this loan to purchase beer, wine, soda, and other kinds of drinks, as she receives many orders and she doesn't want to run out of stock.

loans.use: to purchase beer, wine, soda, and other kinds of drinks to sell.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a 29-year-old married woman with two children aged 8 and 10. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store business in Trinidad, Bohol, where she and her family also live. Editha sells items like eggs, soft drinks, vinegar and soy sauce. Editha earns about 3,000 Php with her store. Editha also raises pigs in her backyard.

Editha requested this loan to buy pig feed and more items to sell such as noodles and canned goods. She hopes for her business to grow and for her family's living conditions to improve.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and more items to sell such as noodles and canned goods.

loans.name: Varsik

texts.en:
Varsik was born in 1959. She lives with her husband in Ddmashen village, in the area of Sevan. She has three children and all of them already live separately from their parents. 

Many years ago Varsik worked as a weaver at a knitting factory. Since 1990 Varsik and her husband have been engaged in animal breeding and land cultivation. With joint effort they breed two cows, a calf and 12 sheep. Also they grow fodder for their farm animals. Varsik and her husband transport produced farm commodities to Yerevan and sell them there. 

This is Varsik’s fourth loan from Nor Horizon and she has never delayed her repayments. Now she is seeking for a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy two more cows and also fodder for farm animals, as their fodder burned down because of a fire.  Varsik and her husband will use future income to buy a truck which will be very helpful them in their agricultural occupation.

loans.use: to buy two more cows and also fodder for farm animals.

loans.name: Hope

texts.en:
Hope is a 37-year-old married woman with three children who are enrolled in school. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of family basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Hope has operated a vegetable grocery for the past 2 years; her potential clients are her friends and relatives. She faces a major challenge of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 12,725 she wants to purchase more cabbages, onions, spinach, potatoes and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more cabbages, onions, spinach, potatoes and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is 35 years old and lives in Gardnersville. She’s married and her husband is a carpenter. They have three children, aged 6 to 23, lall three of whom live at home and attend school.

Faith has been selling charcoal for the past four years.  She was taught how to run the business by a friend.  Her main challenges are the increases in prices for the bag of charcoal.  She is happy when she sells and makes more profit.

She’s requesting a loan to purchase and sell more charcoal. She would like to increase the size of her business.

loans.use: to purchase and sell more charcoal.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a 68-year-old married woman with four children who are all grown up. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Anna has operated a maize-selling business for the past five years; her potential clients are her friends and relatives. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase more sacks of maize for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of maize for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase materials such as cloth and thread.

loans.name: Princess

texts.en:
Princess is 21 years old and lives in Gardnersville.  She is single and has a three-year-old child.  For the past three years Princess has been selling clothes.  She was taught how to run the business by her father.

Princess is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes for her business.  One day she hopes to become an international businesswoman.

loans.use: To buy more clothes as inventory for her business

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is a 49-year-old businessman. He is married to Josephine, a farmer. They are blessed with five children, ages 24, 22, 20, 18, and 16 years. He has been running a retail shop for the past four years with a monthly income of KES 15,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan term with KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Benjamin will use the loan to buy a stock of sugar and rice for his shop. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy a stock of sugar and rice for his shop.

loans.name: Mwanapili

texts.en:
Mwanapili is a 40-year-old single mother of two children. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Mwanapili has operated a poultry selling business for the past three years. Her potential clients are her friends and relatives. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase chicks and chicken feed for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feed for her business.

loans.name: Metrine

texts.en:
Metrine is thirty-five years old, married, and has three children. The children are ages 10, 8, and 5 years respectively. She has a grocery shop that has existed for the past ten years. Her monthly income from the business is KES 12,000. 

She is requesting a loan of KES 10,000 from KADET LTD to purchase more stock. Profit from her business would help her expand and repay her loan.

loans.use: to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables, and dozens of fruits.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 37 years old and is from Naivasha town. She is a single mother to three children between 18 years and 5 years old.

Margaret has a beauty salon that she runs. She has applied for a loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy shampoos, towels, and some chairs to add to her stock.

She hopes to open up a barber shop in the same place.

loans.use: to buy shampoos, towels, and chairs to add to her stock.

loans.name: Brendah

texts.en:
Brendah is a forty-year-old mother who hails from Western Kenya. She is married to Philip and they have three children.

Brendah operates a retail shop, a business she has done for the last ten years, and makes a monthly income of 15,000 Kenya shillings. She is taking a second loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to pay school fees for one of her children.

Her dream is to educate her children through the Kadet school fees loan product.

loans.use: to pay for her child's school fees.

loans.name: Prospero 2012 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PROSPERO 2012” iniciará su primero ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Villa Adela, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Yudema. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de calzados deportivos, venta de cosméticos, venta de joyas, tejido de manta de vicuñas, venta de chicharrón y tripitas, venta de joyas

La señora Yudema,  indica que es la primera vez que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de sus amigas. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de calzados deportivos que viene trabajando hace algún tiempo.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de calzados deportivos) que adquirirá de Perú, por mayor, y posteriormente lo comercializará en puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las asociaciones.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Prospero 2012” will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Adela office. It is made up of seven members and is directed by a governing committee headed by Ms. Yudeman. The businesses carried out by the bank's members are varied. Among them we have sporting footwear sales, cosmetics sales, jewelry sales, manufacture of woven blankets from vicuña wool, sausage and chitterlings sales, and jewelry sales. 

Ms. Yudema indicates that this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer and that she joined the institution at the invitation of her friends. Currently she has a business selling sporting footwear which she has worked at for some time. 

The loan she will take out now is to increase her capital (for the purchase of sporting footwear) which she will obtain in Peru, wholesale, and later sell at her sales booth. This type of work allows her to generate resources for supporting her family since she is single and has a son. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the collaboration.

loans.use: to purchase sporting footwear.

loans.name: Cleophus

texts.en:
Cleophus is a 37-year-old businessman. He is married to Tabitha, a farmer. They are blessed with one child. 

He has been running a butchery for the past three years with the monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan from KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Cleophus will use the loan to buy a slaughtering bull for his stock. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop for his wife.

loans.use: To buy a slaughtering bull for his stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize, millet and beans to resell.

loans.name: Martha Kumba

texts.en:
This is 26-year-old Martha from the Goodrich Western area in Freetown. She is married with no children for now. 

She began this business because six years ago, she had the desire to start a business when she was a student at Njala University. 

Martha runs a general merchandise store. She sells mosquito spray, drinks, luncheon meats, sardines, bags of sugar, beer, stout, milk, baked beans, and toilet rolls. She has been running this business for four years. She works at her business seven days per week. She also has a jeep, which she rents or hires out. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of enough capital to invest.

Martha has requested a loan in order to purchase more food and domestic commodities. The extra income from this loan will allow her business to grow and improve her standard of living. In the future, she plans to open more provision stores and cars stores. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: To purchase more mosquito spray, drinks, luncheon meats, sardines and bags of sugar.

loans.name: Benter

texts.en:
Benter is 52 years old from Nakuru and is married with three children who are between 18 and 11 years old.

Benter has a business of selling handbags and has been doing it for the past two years. 

She is applying for her first loan to enable her buy more bags to add to her stock.

She hopes to open up a boutique in the future.

loans.use: To buy more handbags to add to her stock.

loans.name: Levon

texts.en:
Levon was born in 1957 in Ijevan City. He is married and has three children: two daughters and a son. His son is school-aged, one daughter is a student, and his elder daughter graduated from the institute two years ago but is still jobless. 

For 12 years Levon worked as a warehouse manager at Ijevan's building administration. After that he moved from Armenia to Russia, but in 2000 he returned to his native land and organized his own food and household goods business. During these years, with income from his business, Levon was able to support his family and pay for his daughters’ education. 

With his first Kiva loan, Levon increased the assortment of goods in his shop. Thanks to income from his business, Levon built on an additional storey of his shop and also was able to roof it. But he hasn’t made interior repairs of that additional storey yet. Also Levon has partitioned off a part of his shop, where he has placed three computers and has started to manage an internet-cafe. That fact allows him to increase his profit from his businesses. 

Now Levon is seeking a 1,000,000 AMD loan to increase his shop assortment before the New Year’s holidays. With his loan he will buy beverages and foods, candy, confectionery, sausages, etc. for his shop. His future income will be spent to make interior repair of the additional storey of his shop and to move his new internet-cafe to that storey.

loans.use: to buy beverages and foods, candy, confectionery, sausages, etc. for his shop.

loans.name: Idi

texts.en:
Idi wants a loan to buy tires so as to make sandals. He has been in this business for four years.

The 30-year-old enterprising man lives in Masindi, Uganda. He is solely charged with a responsibility of taking care of his wife and three children.

He dreams of expanding business into new areas and building a permanent house.

loans.use: to buy old tires so as to make sandals.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 37-year-old single mother of two children who are enrolled in school. She lives in a rental house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Mariam has operated a food stall for the past two years. Her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase more stocks of wheat flour, beans, coconuts, cooking oil and charcoal for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of wheat flour, beans, coconuts, cooking oil and charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Tayseer

texts.en:
Tayseer is a 50-year-old married man from Madaba, Jordan and a father of three children.

Tayseer has a shoe shop and he is requesting a loan of 1500 JD to redecorate the shop and purchase additional quantities of shoes.

Tayseer is looking to open a new branch for his shop with an aspiration of increasing his income so that he can cover his children's education expenses.

loans.use: to redecorate his shop.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is 40 years old and lives in Gardnersville. She is married and her husband is a security man. They have four children between 10 and 20 years old. The children live at home and attend school.

For the past ten years, Cecelia has been selling fufu (an African food made out of cassava). She was taught how to run the business by her mother. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more fufu for her business. She plans is to become an international businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more fufu (an African food made out of cassava) for her business.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice has operated her beauty salon business in Nakuru town for the past five years. She is 29 years old and a single mother to one school-going child.

She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by one of her friends and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan to buy more hair products and cosmetics for use in her salon and also sell some to her clients.

In the future, Beatrice hopes to expand her business by buying more hair dryers and have a big cosmetics shop, thereby increasing her income and improving her living standards.

loans.use: To buy more hair products and cosmetics for use in her salon.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 38 years old and from Nakuru. He is married to Monicah and they have one son who is 6 years old.

Richard has a cereals (grains and dry beans) business that he has been doing for the past two years. He is applying for a loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy more rice, green grams (mung beans), sugar, etc. to add to his stock.

He hopes to open up a bigger shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy rice, green grams (mung beans), and sugar to add to his stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy salt and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Kideth

texts.en:
Kideth is a 36-year-old hardworking lady with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. Her personal goals are to educate her children and to build a permanent house for residence.

She has been a retailer for the last thirteen years and her major hardship is inadequate capital to purchase stock. However, she has a goal of expanding her business to new areas.

Kideth needs a loan to buy sugar, rice, and millet flour for resale.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and millet flour for resale.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres du groupe DANAYA sont essentiellement des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 38  ans, et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygamiques à Mancourani I, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur onzième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts antérieures ont été remboursés sans aucune difficulté.
KADIA  1ère à droite sur la photo fait le commerce des fruits à travers dans ce groupe de femmes DANAYA, sa renommée en la matière fait d’elle une vendeuse très sollicitée. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt,  des chargements de charrettes en fruits frais: oranges, papayes, ananas, raisins et bananes. Elle les revend au comptant et à crédit à sa clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages avoisinants  Sikasso et souvent au grand marché de Médine à Sikasso ville.
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 57.500 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et l’autre pour son épargne .
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The seven members of the Danaya group are mainly married women who average 38 years of age and three children each. Most of them live in polygamous families in Mancourani I, a working-class neighborhood of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).

They are seeking their eleventh loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet customer demand. All previous loans were repaid without problems.

KADIA is a member of this group who sells fruits. She is first on the right in the photo. Her reputation in this sector has made her a popular seller. She intends to use her loan to purchase cartloads of fresh fruit including oranges, papayas, pineapples, grapes and bananas. She resells it for cash or on credit to a clientele comprising both men and women.

She buys her merchandise in the villages surrounding Sikasso and at the main market of Medina, in Sikasso.

She intends to turn an average monthly profit of 57,500 FCFA, to be used in part to repay the loan, and in part to bolster her savings. Her goal is to increase her turnover to better satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruits for resale.

loans.name: Jenipher

texts.en:
Jenipher is a twenty-eight-year-old lady from Kisumu City, Western Kenya.  She is married to David and they have two children, aged 2 and 8 years.

Jenipher has been selling charcoal for the last eight years and she makes a monthly income of KES 20,000. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy sacks of charcoal for resale. She will use her profits to educate her children.

Her dream is to buy and sell charcoal wholesale.

loans.use: To buy a stock of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Unidas Triunfaremos Group

texts.es:
Roció tiene 45 años  es una señora muy activa tiene 03 hijos el menor de 13 años ,  ella empezó con el tema de los cosméticos como la mayoría de mujeres siendo consumidora fue así 	que incursiono en el negocio, primero entro como consultora al ver que era una buena oportunidad se preparo asistiendo a talleres de técnicas de belleza, ventas y liderazgo todo este conocimiento adquirido fue de gran ayuda para convertirse en una buena vendedora  así lo demostró al ir creciendo, en la actualidad tiene a su cargo muchas vendedoras que al igual que ella ofrecen diversos productos de belleza como perfumes, cremas, talcos, cosméticos diversos y joyas, los ingresos que perciben son de mucha ayuda porque ha podido darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y una buena educación, también ayudar a su madre que está a su cargo, lo que ahora quiere es lograr poner un establecimiento dedicado íntegramente a lo que es el rubro de belleza donde pueda vender sus productos directamente y brindar servicios diversos como limpiezas faciales maquillaje etc. Roció tiene experiencia y también la ayuda que le brindan sus hijas es importante para ella, acaba de ser elegida la nueva tesorera del grupo “UNIDAS TRIUNFAREMOS” el préstamo obtenido le servira para el pago de sus pedidos de productos así puede seguir invirtiendo.

   * La Sra Rocio es la 5ta de las paradas.
texts.en:
Roció, age 45, is a very active woman with three children.  The youngest is 13.  She started with cosmetics like most women, as a consumer.  That is how she got into the business.  She first started as a consultant.  Upon seeing that this was a good opportunity, she went to workshops on beauty techniques, sales, and leadership.  All of this acquired knowledge was of great help to becoming a good saleswoman.  This can be seen as the business is growing.  

She currently is in charge of a lot of saleswomen who, just like her, sell diverse beauty products like perfume, powder, and different cosmetics and jewelry.  The income that she gets is of great help because she has been able to give her children a better quality of life and a good education.  She also has been able to help her mother, who is under her care.

What she wants now is to manage to set up an establishment that is dedicated entirely to the field of beauty.  She would be able to sell her products directly, and she would provide various services like facials, cleansing, and makeup, etc.  Roció has experience, and she also has help from her daughters, which is important to her.

She has just been selected to be the new treasurer of the Unidas Triunfaremos communal bank.  She will use the loan to pay for her product orders.  This way she will continue investing.

*Rocio is the fifth woman standing.

loans.use: to pay for beauty product orders.

loans.name: Gleysi Del Socorro

texts.es: Gleysi es una emprendedora que toda su vida ha luchado por salir adelante y apoyar a su familia en los gastos del hogar. Ella ya ha tenido crédito con Fundación León 2000, en cual mantiene un record muy bueno y nos expresa que el financiamiento que se le otorgo anteriormente lo invirtió en mercadería en general. Actualmente está solicitando crédito para invertir nuevamente en variedad de mercadería para sus clientes.
texts.en: Gleysi has been an enterprising woman who has struggled all her life to get ahead and help her family to cover household costs. She has already had a loan with “Fundacion Leon 2000” and maintained a very good record. Gleysi explains that the financing provided previously was invested in buying general merchandise. At present, she is soliciting a loan to invest anew in a variety of merchandise for her customers.

loans.use: buy a variety of merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Mahmadali

texts.ru: Махмадали проживает в городе Душанбе. Ему 32 года. Он женат. У него трое детей. Махмадали занимается торговлей продуктов питания. Также он продает хозяйственные товары. Этим видом деятельности он занимается три года. Кредит  берет для покупки продуктов питания.
texts.en: Mahmadali lives in Dushanbe. He's thirty-two years old, married and has three children. For the past three years he has made a living by selling household supplies and groceries. He's asking for a loan in order to purchase some food products.

loans.use: to purchase food products.

loans.name: Heydi Sugey

texts.es: Heydi es una emprendedora que se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos, además tiene otra actividad que es la venta de mercadería en general, ella ya ha recibo financiamiento por Fundación León 2000, lo cual atenido un record crediticio intachable es una persona responsable y sobre todo persevante . Esta vez esta solicitando financiamiento para comprar variedad de mercadería en general y ofrecerles a sus clientes.
texts.en: Heydi is an enterprising woman, dedicated to selling milk products. She has an additional activity which is selling general merchandise. She previously received financing through “Fundacion Leon 2000”, and has achieved an impeccable record as a responsible and, above all, persevering individual. This time, she is requesting financing to buy a variety of general merchandise to offer her customers.

loans.use: buy a variety of general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen is a 33-year-old single parent living in a rented house in Fort Portal Uganda. She owns a bar that she has operated since 2008. She faces challenges including price fluctuations, inflation, taxes, and seasonal customers. Her dream is to build a permanent home and buy land to grow crops. Hellen needs this loan to buy two refrigerators and drinks to sell.

loans.use: to buy two refrigerators and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his business by buying more quarrying equipment and by leasing land for quarrying.

loans.name: Jiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe JIGUIYA sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 38  ans, et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygamiques à SANOUBOUGOU II, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts antérieures se sont  bien dénoués.
MARIAM, debout au milieu sur la photo vend des plats alimentaires dans ce  groupe de femmes JIGUIYA. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt  des condiments,  1 sac de riz,  2 caisses de la pomme de terre et 4 paniers de salade (laitue).  Elle vend ses plats au comptant à sa clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Sikasso et souvent au grand marché du quartier Médine à Sikasso ville.
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 37.500 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne .
texts.en:
The six members of the Jiguiya group are married women averaging 38 years of age, with three children. They live mainly in polygamous families in Sanoubougou II, a working-class district of the city of Sikasso.

They are on their fourth loan with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, with the goal of meeting customer demand. The prior loans have been duly repaid. 

Mariam, standing in the middle of the photo, is a Jiguiya group member who sells cooked dishes. She plans to use her loan to buy condiments, one bag of rice, two cases of potatoes and four baskets of lettuce. She sells her cooked food for cash to a customer base composed of both men and women. She stocks up at the big market of Sikasso and often at the big market of the Médine district of Sikasso. She plans to achieve an average monthly profit of 37,500 West African Francs,  a part of which will be used to repay the loan with interest, and the rest  will go to her savings.

loans.use: to buy ingredients needed to cook food for sale

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is applying for another loan to expand her boutique business. She will use this 80,000 KES loan to purchase more stocks of jewelry, clothes, handbags, and lesos (kanga cloth) for resale. In the future, Alice aspires to continue improving her business. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Alice has greatly improved her living standards. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of jewelry, clothes, handbags, and lesos (kanga cloth) for resale.

loans.name: San Miguel (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal San Miguel está conformado por 7 socias quienes son mujeres trabajadoras, luchadoras y emprendedoras, laboran en diferentes actividades las mismas que les permiten mejorar la estabilidad económica de sus hogares. Viven por los alrededores de la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, lugar con una exuberante naturaleza, uno de sus atractivos  turísticos es la laguna de Cochapamba (llenas de totoras), su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales, a la agricultura y muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Mariana, ella se dedica al cuidado de su familia y como pasa en casa también cría y vende cerdos y pollos, sus animales los vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica. Este  trabajo le ha permitido aportar  a la economía de su hogar y sacar adelante a su familia. Se dedica a esta actividad desde que se ha casado.
 
El dinero de este crédito lo va ha invertir en la compra de cerdos, pollos y en alimento para animales.

Ella se siente muy orgullosa ya que en el pago de su crédito anterior no ha tenido ninguna dificultad y ya realizo la cancelación total del mismo sin contratiempos. El banco comunal le gusta por las charlas educativas que les brindan y por el compañerismo que existen entre todo el grupo.

Por esta ocasión nos acompaña en la fotografía el Señor Eulogio que es coordinadorde la Fundación Espoir.
texts.en:
The San Miguel communal bank is composed of 7 members, all hard-working, combative and enterprising women who work in different activities that permit them to improve the economic stability of their homes. They live on the outskirts of Del Valle in Cuenca, a location where nature is  exuberant. A local tourist attraction is Lake Cochapamba (filled with tall reeds). The people are dedicated to commerce, animal raising, agriculture, while many work in the city in different activities.

One of the group members is Mariana. She cares for her family and, since she stays at home, also raises and sells pigs and chickens. She sells them when the economic need arises. This work allows her to aid the household economy and advance her family. Mariana has done this since she has been married.

The funds from this loan will be used to buy pigs, chickens, and animal feed. Mariana is very proud of the fact that she had no trouble in paying off her previous loan. She paid the debt completely without difficulty.

Mariana likes her communal bank for the educational talks it offers and for the companionship that exists among the group.

This time we are providing a photograph of Eulogio who is coordinator of the “Fundacion Espoir.”

loans.use: buy pigs, chickens, and animal feed.

loans.name: Suhrob

texts.ru: Сухроб проживает в городе Вахдат. Ему 49 лет. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Его жена занимается домашним хозяйством. Сам он у себя дома занимается ремонтом машин. На сегодняшний день он намерен открыть авто мойку. Для этого ему необходимо приобрести оборудования и стройматериалы.
texts.en: Suhrob lives in the city of Vahdat.  He is 49 years old, married and has four children.  His wife is involved in household work.  Suhrob is involved in repairing cars at home.  Today, he intends to open a car wash and needs to purchase equipment and construction materials to accomplish this.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and construction materials

loans.name: Bozorboi

texts.ru: Бозорбой трудолюбивый и добрый человек. Он женат и имеет шестерых детей. Он мясник. У него большая семья , а также большие расходы. Чтобы покрыть расходы и содержать семью Бозорбой начал заниматься продажей мясо. Он покупает скот, затем откармливает  и продает  мясо на рынке. Бозорбой покупает скот в деревнях по дешевым ценам. Он в этом бизнесе уже более 15 лет и имеет достаточно богатый опыт. Бозорбой хотел бы получить займ в размере 10000 сомони для покупки скота.
texts.en: Bozorboi is a hardworking and kind person.  He is married and has six children.  He is a butcher.  Bozorboi has a large family and also high expenses.  In order to cover the expenses and support the family, he became involved in selling meat.  He buys livestock, then fattens it up and sells meat at a market.  Bozorboi buys livestock in villages at cheap prices.  He has been in this business for over 15 years and has a sufficiently rich experience.  Bozorboi wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 10,000 somoni to purchase livestock.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Fakhridin

texts.ru: Фахридин проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 37 лет. У него трое детей. Он занимается животноводством. В основном он откармливает и продает скот. Кредит берет для закупа коровы и телят.
texts.en: Fakhridin lives in the Yavan district.  He is 37 years old and has three children.  He is involved in animal husbandry.  He primarily fattens up and sells livestock.  Fakhridin is requesting this loan to purchase a cow and calves.

loans.use: to buy a cow and calves

loans.name: Winrose

texts.en: Winrose is 37 years old, married and has five children who range in age from 6 to 18 years old. She is a very outgoing woman, and has earned a living for the last six years by running a restaurant where she sells food, beverages and snacks. Her business is located in an urban area and she has many regular customers. She also runs a side business selling baskets and farm produce. Her biggest challenge is a lack of funds to improve her restaurant. She is applying for a loan for KES 10,000 to buy supplies to weave new baskets to sell. Her goals for the future are to open a hotel and sell baskets on a wholesale basis.

loans.use: to buy supplies needed to make new baskets to sell.

loans.name: Weniger

texts.es: Weniger de 35 años, es un hombre que siempre está activo, le gusta mucho sentirse útil y trabajar para poder mantener y dar buenas condiciones de vida a su familia. Convive con Nolita de 33 años con quien tiene un hijo de 7 años llamado Fernando. Cuando algún conocido o cliente nuevo desea realizar una construcción, levantar una pared, armar una casa o instalar cables a una vivienda, no dudan en llamarlo, ya que su trabajo consiste en realizar construcciones de casa y electrificar las mismas. Lleva realizando éste trabajo por 3 años de manera independiente ya que antes de eso trabajaba para otras personas y fue ahí en donde aprendió y ganó mucha experiencia. Le esta yendo muy bien, tiene muchos contratos y siempre Realiza su trabajo de buena manera y con todos los implementos de seguridad ya que no quiere tener accidentes que lamentar. En un inicio trabajaba para otras personas, pero con el pasar del tiempo tuvo más experiencia y ahora trabaja independiente recibiendo directamente las ganancias. Ahora lo que más desea es implementarse con más herramientas y equipos que le permitan realizar bien su trabajo. Este será el primer préstamo con MFP, está muy contento de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá seguro de avanzar con su negocio. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará materiales, herramienta y equipos que necesita para continuar con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Weniger, age 35, is a man who is always active.  He likes to feel useful, and he works to be able to support his family and give them good living conditions.  He lives with 33 year old Nolita, and they have a seven year old son, Fernando.

When an acquaintance or new customer wants to undertake a construction, raise a wall, build a house or install cables in a house; they do not hesitate to call him.  His work consists of building houses and wiring them for electricity.  He has been doing this work independently for three years.  Before that he worked for other people, and that is where he learned and gained a lot of experience.

It is going very well for him.  He has a lot of contracts, and he always does his work in a good way.  He always has safety equipment because he does not want to have accidents to regret.  When he started he worked for other people.  However, as time passed he had more experience.  He now works independently, and he receives his earnings directly.

What he now wishes for most of all is to set himself up with more tools and equipment, which would allow him to do his work well.  This will be his first loan with MFP.  He is very happy to know that he will have the support of a loan.  This way he will feel that he will advance with his business.  He will use the requested 1,000 soles to buy materials, tools, and equipment that he needs to continue with his work.

loans.use: to buy materials, tools, and equipment that he needs for his work.

loans.name: Cadith

texts.es: Cadith, de 49 años, es una mujer muy amble, trabajadora y muy perseverante, es madre soltera ya que desafortunadamente se separo de su conviviente hace mucho tiempo, ahora ella vive en su casa propia junto a sus 5 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Cadith comienza muy temprano por la mañana, cuando abre su puesto y empieza con la venta de pollos. Su negocio está ubicado en el mercado de su ciudad, ella es una vendedora muy persuasiva y siempre logra sacar una sonrisa de sus clientes. Cuando se inicio en éste negocio recuerda que no sabia nada del mismo y tuvo que trabajar mucho pero poco a poco logró obtener ganancias. Lleva 6 años en esta actividad y hasta el momento lo ha hecho sola. Para el futuro desea tener un local donde pueda vender con mayor tranquilidad la carne de pollo. Este será el crédito número 18 con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos, por su parte se compromete una vez mas en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado de 3000 soles, comprará más pollos para cubrir mejor la demanda de sus clientes y seguir vendiendo en su puesto.
texts.en: Cadith, who is 49 years old, is a very kind, hard-working, and persevering woman. She is a single mother, since unfortunately she separated from her partner some time ago. Now she lives in her own house together with her five beloved children, to whom she wants to offer a better quality of life. Cadith's work begins very early in the morning, when she opens her stall and begins with the sale of chickens. Her business is located in the market in her city. She is a very persuasive saleswoman, and she always succeeds in getting a smile from her customers. When she began this business, she recalls that she didn't know anything about it and had to work a lot, but, little by little, she succeeded in obtaining earnings. She has been in this business for six years, and up to now she has done it alone. In the future she would like to have a shop where she can sell chicken in a more peaceful setting. This will be her 18th loan with MFP, so she hopes for your help to continue with her goals. On her part, she promises once more to make her loan payments. With the 3000 PEN that she is applying for, she will buy more chickens to better cover the demands of her customers and to continue selling at her stall.

loans.use: to buy more chickens
